1121111.title: The next day

113.content:
A decision that proved impossible weighed before you. As the fighting began, you could only watch in horror as your group of fourteen men went into battle with the two lone dragons, without your protection.

"Gah, Damn it all! men, forget orders and destroy all you see. Forget about the damn stone!"

'What? Stone... do they mean the egg?’ Not much time to ponder the question, the dragon pair soon ran down upon your group. The dragons obviously had much more strength than the humans did and because they were protecting their little one, they were all the more dangerous. The humans however had numbers on their side however much it helped against two full-grown dragons.

At first, the dragons seemed to be winning with their sheer power as they slashed through the first two victims in one fell swipe. The tides quickly turned however, to your surprise, and the last attack left them open at the rear that which quickly did five men flank. 'They are more skilled than i thought...' The family seeing this attempted to hit them with their tails but only struck three as the others jumped to their backs and tried to slash at their spines. A quick jump jarred the attackers off and the fight resumed.

You quickly realized that through the chaos, the egg was completely vulnerable and nearly crushed more than you would have wanted. Knowing that if you could save someone, it would have to be the young, you quickly readied your most powerful defensive spell, Strictura Callum. However, this would not be the case as when you delved into the magical energy you felt a strange presence enter your mind. Having no time to ponder what was happening you threw your arms palm outward toward the egg and nearly screamed out,

"INVIUS OBMOLIOR!" A dim, rainbow colored impenetrable orb soon circled around it and protected it just before one of the men fell right onto it by the power of the dragons. The dragon gave you the slightest glance than quickly went back to the fight. Though it was strange that they did this, it was not you concern now. The egg had to be protected at all costs, even if it was the "enemy." For some reason you could not bear to see it be destroyed.

Though the men were losing numbers, the dragons were tiring with many gashes and cuts in their wings, head, and abdomen. Of the fourteen men, only three remained, including the Captain to your dismay. Surprisingly their moral had not faltered in the least even though more than three quarters of the group rested eternally on the cave floor. The dragons, in their weakened state, gave the men a small advantage. The two others quickly overtook the female and while she unleashed a powerful blast of flame onto one, rendering him no more than a pile of ash, the other rushed in and sliced through her neck, severing the head.

The male seeing this became mad with rage and quickly bit the killer in half, but in his blind rage, he left himself open and the Captain stabbed him in the heart through a week spot above his shoulder. With his last moments in life, he quickly turned to his own killer and opened his giant maw. Before he bit into the flesh, the captain seemed to sigh outward. "I never should have trusted that bastard..." And the dragon bit him directly in half, throwing both halves aside. The Dragon then gave a glance at his young, the egg, and then looked at you with sorrowful eyes. A voice then ran through your head. "Though you are a human, you still protected our young even as we tried to kill your fellow companions, I thank you... " 'It was the Dragon! But... but how?' "I am no longer able to protect him so I put him in your caring hands... rider..." and with that he took his last breath.

Baffled by the dragon speaking in your thoughts and even more so he entrusted you, a human, with his young, you took the time to gaze at the carnage around you. This was a complete slaughter. No one left alive, save yourself. You could not save anyone, human or dragon. The emotions running through you were too vast to control. Hate, sorrow, pity, but worst of all, weakness. Overcome with emotion, you could do nothing but stare. It did not take long for the smell of burnt flesh to have an effect and you curled over and threw the remains of your pre-battle meal over the ground.

After a period and your stomach drained its contents, you looked at the egg that you protected and thought of what the Father had said. Why did he call me rider? You thought for an answer but found none. Throwing it off to dragon custom, you set your mind and returned to the previous topic. If you took the egg you would be fulfilling the last wish of its father, but taking it and then raising it... could prove to be a worse fate than your draft into the army. You could not parade around human villages with a dragon. It would only get you and the dragon executed. It would be self-exile. If you did go back with it, you would have to turn to hiding, but you would eventually be found out. Things this big always have nasty habits of grabbing attention in some way or another. Nevertheless, leaving it there would only make you feel even worse. Not only had you aided in the killing of its parents to an extent, you would leave the egg their all alone only for it to hatch at the sight of the carnage before you now. 'It would not survive a week...'

You had to choose...
113.title: Slaughter at the family cave

1131.content:
You decide to take the egg with you no matter the consequences. You would not be able to handle the guilt if you left it there. Even more so the thought of leaving it gave you same feeling as if you were leaving someone very precious to you. You couldn't perceive where this thought could have came from, but you did not care anymore as the egg was far more precious than anything in the world to you at the moment.

As you approached the egg, you were relieved to see that the strange spell had worked perfectly. Not even a speck of dust had grazed the beautiful shell, which while you played it off to the darkness of the cave, was in fact black. No that was to simple of a word for the color you were witnessing. It shined in the moonlight with such a beautiful glow, it could easily pass off as a incredibly large opal stone. 'I wonder what happened back there... Those words I said... I have never heard them before but they seemed so... ah never mind, I have to think of what to do now'

You picked the egg up and started hurrying toward the entrance when you were suddenly stopped by...
1131.title: Precious gem

11311.content:
You stopped cold in your tracks looking around everywhere for source the noise, but did not see anything. You started walking more cautiously than before and again heard the squeaking.''What the hell is that? It sounds so close yet I don't see anything.' you wondered, setting the egg down trying to get a better look around.

Again the squeak came but this time so did another noise. Rocks moving around the ground, very close to you. Quickly turning toward the noise you notice the egg wobbling slightly. 'No... it can't be this close to hatching already can it? What am I supposed to do if it hatches? It could attack me!' Just then the squeak came louder and you noticed a crack in the shell. Fearing the worst you stumbled backward and began crawling slowly away extremely cautious of the emerging creature. Soon the crack bobbed up and down as if on a top and finally fell to the ground revealing a opal nose matching that of the shell. It did not take long for the rest of the shell to come off the small creature. It stumbled along the ground looking weakly at its surroundings. You had a slight twinge of fear but that was rapidly vanishing as you stared at the small dragon-ling. Having finished its first look around the beginning of the cave it looks toward you and quickly locks with your eyes once you are in its sight.

How could something so beautiful be as dangerous as people say. They are intelligent enough to speak and even hold their own royal family in the deep recesses of Sulu. This reason made you wonder how the war was even started, but you quickly withdrew that from your mind as you once again concentrated on the majesty that stood before you.

As you slowly moved your hand toward it, not wanting to frighten it, it moved it's head toward you, Almost eagerly. As you got closer you felt something strange. Like a continuous breeze of cool air on your face, It put you at ease. When you finally touched it's forehead, You were completely immersed
in this feeling from head to toe. As you moved your hand away the feeling receded only slightly. 'What was that? It felt good... I wonder if it has to do with this dragon... seems like the only thing it could be.'

As if reading your thoughts, the little one began getting excited bobbing its little head up and down and swinging its tail around. You can only chuckle slightly at the newborns antics, that is until he leaped onto your lap and began lapping at your chin with a warm tongue, making you let out a small yelp in surprise.'Damn It looked like it was going for my neck! He may be just born but im sure those teeth are still pretty damn sharp.' Again as if hearing you in your thoughts the dragon stopped its licking and looked at you with sorrowful eyes shaking its head quickly and giving you what could only be described as a frown. 'Odd... I wonder if he can somehow read my expressions or something... he reacts to everything I do and think... wait think?! sigh... given the circumstances I don't think it would be wrong to think I'm completely insane.

Again responding to your train of thought it rams you in the side waking you from your mind struggle. It looks at you roughly and you begin to see thoughts that aren't your own flow into your mind. Some confusion, but mainly happiness and a strange reassurance that this really was happening. 'Maybe... yes... I don't know what it is, but this little guy really is growing on me.' Suddenly satisfied the newborn curls up onto your chest and slowly drifts into his first sleep outside his first home. Feeling the rhythm of his tiny heart you as well are soon lulled to sleep.
11311.title: Little one

113111.content:
Waking quickly, you notice to your relief the dragon still on your chest. You move to get up then suddenly notice a sharp pain in you upper back near your shoulders. When you reach back to feel, there is nothing there but the pain persists until you get off your back for a good while.

Wondering about the ghost pain, your mind drifts elsewhere until finally coming back to the dragon, who was just now waking.

"You need a name." you proclaimed to the dragon who grew anxious at the thought. Somehow, it knew what was happening, but you could not figure out how. The same Anxiety flew through your mind at that time and a wild thought came to you. Was this emotion from the dragon? You quickly brushed off the idea knowing it was insane but still kept the thought at the edge of your mind.

"How about Reineer?" you asked in a joking tone not expecting an answer. Though the dragon did not give you one verbally, he did shake his head quite strongly. Wow, it understood me. Even at birth dragons can comprehend so much! A rush then enveloped your mind, completely enveloping you. Instead of retreating or fighting back, you welcomed it. This feeling was calm and reassuring, as if the presence had the same feelings that you held for the dragon youth.

As you bathed in the feeling in your mind, a crazy idea came to mind. What if this was the dragon's doing, sending me these soothing images to calm me down. Almost immediately after the thought vanished a wave of confirmation drove itself into your mind. "You are indeed something special little one. Now back to your name," thinking hard only one name stuck for this Opal beauty. "How about Thanatos?" The wave of assurance entered your mind and the dragon jumped toward your face licking vigorously, obviously happy that it had a name.

You then knew that you had to leave the cave and head somewhere safe to raise Thanatos well, and keep you both safe from harm. Your defensive spells may have been strong, but you had no training in attacking with them. Using unknown spells is something you knew not to try. Unless you knew exactly what to do with the spell, It could have random effects, worst of all backfiring in your face. You had to leave to somewhere safe but in your situation where could you go?

If you went back home, the militia would question what happened at the cave unless you avoided them and if you did for long enough they would consider you a deserter and throw your family in prison as a way of paying for your deed. Also, Thanatos would most definitely grow at an alarming rate and would only make it more difficult to hide his presence. No this option was out of the question.

The only other two both required you to leave the Human Territory and into the Dragons. You could travel To the Jupin wood across the Xanthen river. Once there, hope you are not seen so you could raise Thanatos peacefully. Also you could attempt to confront some dragons and request their aid. If they saw that you were unarmed, they would not kill you and you knew that Thanatos would be there to help out the situation also.
113111.title: Thanatos

1131112.content:
Seeking the aid of the ones who raised dragons regularly made the most sense. A look from Thanatos only confirmed it. You began traveling West toward a nesting site you learned of on the point where Jupin wood and Sulu mountains meet. Though you might have to cross the Xanthen river, you knew there was no choice.

You traveled directly through the mountains as to avoid the border struggles that were all to common near this area. As you walked, you held Thanatos in your arms, ready to shield him from harm if there was any. He welcomed the protection and nuzzled your chest.

Hunger soon crept into your stomach and your thoughts. Thanatos must be hungry to. You may not have known strong attack spells, but you could still kill medium sized game. You picked up a couple stones about marble sized for ammunition and went stalking for game, setting Thanatos in a safe clearing. You tried to tell him to stay through your mind and after sending him images of his catch and him staying, he seemed to understand.

Though you lived a mild city life, Your father still took you hunting, so if you ever needed to you would know how. Thanking your father's memory, you spotted a group of elk. Bigger than anything you had hoped to find, but welcomed your luck none the less. You grabbed one stone and grabbed the right spell from your mind. Once ready you cast it, "Calx Missus!", and the stone jumped from your hand and barreled toward your target. It struck it right through the heart and it did not get more than 10 feet before collapsing dead.

You called Thanatos over to your location using your mind. Though doing this was knew to you, it was extremely simple and would only make your love for Thanatos stronger as you now relished every thought that came to his immature mind. He came quicker than expected and upon seeing the animal, dug his face into the meat and feasted. While he ate you started a fire and took a pan from your rucksack. good thing the militia forces you to bring these.

As you finished cooking your own meal, Thanatos finished his own feast. You were surprised at how much he could eat. A noise then startled you to your feet.

"Thank you Trent." You knew where the noise came from. It had the same feeling as Thanatos's thoughts. You were surprised that he had learned so fast. Though he couldn't have a conversation with you yet, you would try to teach him until he could. Them meal done, you stripped the animal of what ever meat was left and preserved it in your sack.

You traveled further West for 2 weeks hunting whenever necessary and finally came to the mouth of the river. To your good fortune you did not even have to cross the river, you could literally go around it. It seemed that the river began from a small spring here. It amazed you that the largest river in Shoven could start in such a small form. Relieved at your luck you began heading Southwest out of the mountains towards your destination. Hunting every other day, you never ran out of food and teaching Thanatos to speak proved to be easier than expected. In time, you could hold a conversation with him only pausing a few times to explain a certain difficult word. It took 9 more days to see the forest in the distance were the mountains ended. You decided to camp there and head to the forest tomorrow.

(A.N. Calx Missus translated literally means Stone shot.)
1131112.title: Trail to Sulu Breeding Grounds

11311121.content:
You woke to the deafening sound of a roar above your head. As you looked up you saw an emerald green dragon come into view. What should have been fear turned out to be joy. This would make contacting the dragons that much easier if they came to you.

The Gem-like dragon swooped down in front of you with teeth bared. It would not attack you as you were unarmed, but it was happy to threaten you. Startled, Thanatos quickly jumped in between you and the dragon baring his own teeth in a feeble attempt to scare the mightier beast. Yet feeble as it was, the dragon stepped back obviously surprised to see a dragon defend a human. Voices then rang in your head, one you recognized as Thanatos, the other you assumed was the green dragon.

"Why do you protect this human little one?! He would have you slaughtered in an instant!!"

"Your wrong! Trent wouldn't hurt me or Dragons. He is a nice man and I love him. You will not hurt Trent." The green dragon then lowered his stance and calmed down at the little ones words.

He looked at you with a new awe, eyes wide as dinner plates, and his maw slightly open as if he had now looked at a god. It unsettled you slightly but you did not come here to be questioned. You needed to find a place to raise Thanatos properly.

Finally you spoke up. "I am Trent Godfrey of the Human city Parcel. I admit I was in the militia but not of my own free will. I was forced to join the ranks of a team sent to slaughter a family of dragons." You paused for a moment thinking how Thanatos would react to the truth, but he had to know someday. And now seemed to be as good a time as any. "I am a defensive wizard and followed the group I was with defend them, not knowing their was a family inside." Thanatos eying you confused. "Once I had realized it was a family cave, it was to late. The men began to attack but because I refused to be apart of the fight, I did not help. The dragon pair were outnumbered and there was a bloody fight. It was then I spotted a black egg and I just had to protect it from any harm." Thanatos, now realizing what you meant, had a grave look in his eyes but seemed to understand. It pained you when you saw him like that, yet you had to continue. "The battle raged on and in the end the only survivors of the whole conflict were me, the egg, and it's father, but the latter only barely. In his last words, He told me to take the egg in as my own and care for it with all my heart. Shortly after..." you choked on your words slightly "Thanatos hatched and I have kept my word." At hearing this Thanatos was in shock. His parents were killed by a group that his new protector traveled with. Seeing this you could not help but feel torn inside, afraid that he would reject you and you would be alone again.

"Is this true Trent?" Thanatos asked.

"Yes... I am sorry I made you wait so long to hear the truth but know that I love you with all my heart and will never allow such a slaughter to take place ever again." Thanatos did not speak again and the silence was the most painful thing you have ever felt in your life. Thanatos finally lifted his head toward you and said...
11311121.title: Thanatos's decision

choices: Acknoledges you and your dragon together
113111211.content:
"I believe you. I will always believe you and I want the same from you. No more hiding things from me OK"

"OK, I will tell you more if you wish later, but right now I think our friend here has a few questions don't you?"

"Indeed I do." said the Emerald giant. "First what would possess a human to protect an egg when his own kind are being killed around him." he spoke in an accusing voice as if to say you wanted Thanatos as a slave.

"I'm not entirely sure, but once I laid eyes on the egg I could not let anything harm it or I feared that I wouldn't have the sanity to get through the ordeal. If Thanatos's egg had broken that day I-I don't know what I would have done." The large dragon only stared at you with his large ageless eyes. "By the way, what is your name. That is if you are willing to give it to me."

He calmed his stance further and said "I am Fenrir, Lord of the Jupin Nesting Grounds. Me, along with the rest of my brethren, protect the nests in this area. I came here when I sensed a dragon youth far away from our home to retrieve it only to find you already a hold of him." His last statement left a slight rage in your heart.

"He is here of his own free will Fenrir. You could try to take him away but neither he nor I would let you without a fight!!" Expecting an outburst of anger from him, you prepared for a fight. But to your surprise he...
113111211.title: Thanatos trusts me!!!

1131112111.content:
"I know that now Trent. Since this youth has put his faith in you after what your people have done to his family, so to will I believe you speak the truth. However, If you do wish to raise him with his own kind, you must swear an oath that you will never harm another dragon unless it is in self-defense, or you are protecting someone you love in the process."

You repeat every last word meaning each and every one of them. You could never harm a dragon again even without having said the oath. Not only would Thanatos not allow, you couldn't either.

"Now then, if both of you would be so kind to hop on, I shall take you to the grounds. Be warned Trent, These dragons have not heard what you have said to me so do not approach or speak to anyone until I have confirmed to you they will leave you alone. Am I clear?" You nod happily, eagerly getting on the giants back with Thanatos by your side. Before flying off, Fenrir took one glance toward the trees to your right. Following his gaze, you notice the leaves in one area move more than the wind should allow and then stop almost as soon as they began. 'Must have been an animal i guess' Shrugging it off, you turned you attention to your dragonling.

For the first time you noticed just how big he has gotten in just four weeks! When he hatched he could easily be cradled in your arm but now he was as tall as the middle of your thigh. His wings grew the most now spanning almost six feet from tip to tip. He was growing at an alarming rate and would only keep getting bigger.

Your thought then drifted to your arrival in Jupin Forest. Would they ever come to accept a human and dragon pairing? Would they even agree to let you stay? Worst of all would they try to take Thanatos away from you? No you wouldn't let them do that. You would take him back by force if possible.

Thanatos quickly eased your mind from those thoughts reassuringly, "Don't worry Trent, They will believe you once I tell them what you did for me!."

His enthusiastic voice put your mind at ease and, after Fenrir instructed you to pad your seating, he took off toward the forest.
1131112111.title: The trip to Jupin

11311121111.content:
The trip took only twelve hours from the air. By land it would have been ten days!

He soon dove down to the forest were all manor of dragon resided. Though calm at first, they soon flew into a wild furry at your site. The only thing that stopped them from chewing you in half was Fenrir's obvious status in the land.

"What have you done Fenrir?! This creature has killed our young ones and yours if I am not mistaken! Why would you foul your family and bring them to our land!!!" This dragon, though moderately smaller than Fenrir, held power in the land probably equal to or just under him, or so you thought. His scales were bright red, so much so that they appeared to be blazing in the sun.

"Leave Trent alone!" yelped Thanatos. It warmed your heart to see the lengths you both would go to for each other.

Next came Fenrir's voice "Listen to the little one Flamming, We must not cause any harm for the first rider in more than a millennium." All were caught off guard as they heard these words, muttering to themselves in thought speech. Rider... you heard this somewhere before and whatever it was these dragons were not buying it.

"Wait, the dragon in the cave called me that as well, what does it mean? What is a rider?"

"Please, there will be time for your questions later, right now I have a promise to keep." replied Fenrir, now averting his attention to the dragons. "These two shall be staying with us until The little one has grown to a proper age of maturity. Give them quarters to stay in and treat BOTH of them as one of our own. Do I make myself clear?" A mixture of both rage and mild contempt came from their thoughts as they plodded off to meet their leaders demands. All except the red one, Flamming.

He eyed you down with relentless suspicion, smoke flaring from his nostrils. It seemed that no matter what you or Fenrir say will ease his hate for humans. Though he would comply to his wishes, for how long, you could not tell. Flamming seemed like a loose-cannon, ready to defy a higher-ups orders at any moment. The way Fenrir eyed him only confirmed that your assumption was true. You would have to watch him for awhile. Your thoughts went unnoticed by little Thanatos who could only eye the little bundle riding on Flamming's back as he stalked away. The small bundle was slightly larger than Thanatos was and was returning the curious gaze.

The group of dragons came back relaying that they had the accommodations ready and with that took off quickly into the looming twilight. Fenrir guided you to your new home, It was basic at best with only one bed and a tub, both dragon sized and seemed to be molded seamlessly into the floor. Well it may not be the most luxurious place to live, but I still have Thanatos for company and I would take that over anything. As you lay on the bed, Thanatos crept in beside you and the two of you drifted into sleep.
11311121111.title: The "Friendly" dragons

113111211111.content:
You wake up to Thanatos nudging you in the side playfully. "Wake up, we have to go see Fenrir!"

As you started to get up to greet him, you felt a sharp aching pain from the backs of your shoulders as if you were sleeping on two wooden stakes jabbing into then all night long. You grimaced at the pain then moved your hands toward the pain to try to ease it. You let out a startled yelp when you realize your shoulder didn't hurt, it was the two hard stumps that newly came out of your back. Inspecting the bumps further you notice they are not covered in skin but instead thick scales.

What's more amazing is that the scales matched Thanatos's perfectly, the same dazzling opal color and shine. Is this scaly substance going to cover me completely! You sunk at the thought of never being able to appear before your family again. They would never accept you again, nor could you blame them. You looked closer and to your slight relief, they were not spreading but instead, growing outward, as if these objects had been inside you all along.

"I think their cool looking." Thanatos blurted. At least he would always accept you.

Though even with Thanatos's encouragement, you still needed answers. What were these stumps growing out of your back, and more importantly, what was a rider? Asking Fenrir was the only logical choice and besides, Thanatos was ready to explore the area and you would be hard pressed to try and keep him cooped up in the cave all day. But he might be a little peeved off if you left now since it went against his orders toward you and you weren't really on his list of favorite people.
113111211111.title: Questions revealed

choices: Cast a spell to protect him
1131112111111.content:
You needed answers now. It did not matter what the other dragons thought. If they tried anything you could always defend yourself with spells until Fenrir came to break it up. Thanatos really wanted to explore the forest anyway and who were you to tell him he couldn't.

As you stepped outside, you noticed that the cave you were just in was not a cave at all. It was the base of a mighty tree hundreds of feet high that had bulged at the bottom, creating a perfect space for a dragon home. You couldn't believe your eyes; these "caves" ware on almost every tree at every hight, as if they knew where to grow out for the dragons. Thanatos was just as bewildered.

"How do the trees know where to grow?!" he asked.

"Do I look like I know? I am as baffald as you little one."

"Don't call me that, It is getting annoying being called this instead of my true name."

"Sorry, but you can't blame them. To them you are pretty small." He turned his head away irritated, and you had to stop yourself from bursting into a fit of laughter.

As you moved from tree to tree in search of Fenrir, Thanatos flying above to check the higher dwellings, you heard the loud beating of dragon wings overhead. When you looked up to check for Fenrir, you only saw what looked like a burst of fire as Flamming landed next to you, teeth bared and followed by who you assumed to be his son.

"What the hell was that for?!!" you screamed, falling backwards onto your new stubs, renewing the pain in them. Thanatos quickly flew in between you and Flamming with his own teeth bared, not seeming to notice the vast size difference. "Why do you protect this man!? Was he not the one who killed your parents!?" The accusation infuriated both you and to your surprise, Thanatos.

"Trent did not kill my parents!!! He protected me as my parents fought off the other men! My father trusted him with me in his last breath and I shall do the same. He has saved me once and I shall return the favor time and time again!" The foreign dragon ling seemed awed by Thanatos's words.

"Fine, then you are no better than him and therefor, no dragon!"

"Dad Don't do it!" The little red dragon cried out to his father.

"Stay out of this Blaze! Go home NOW!"

Frightened, the little one now known as Blaze quickly retreated a small distance but never left the scene dreading what his father was about to do. Flamming, recovering quickly from the family struggle, tilted his neck back, the flames on his scales shimmering even brighter. He was going to attack Thanatos! Did he hate Humans so much that he would go through his own kind to kill one? But there was no time to think about his reasoning. you had to do something
1131112111111.title: "Little one" in trouble

11311121111112.content:
There was no time to cast a spell strong enough to defend against dragon flame, especially at this close range. Thanatos would be incinerated if you did not do something. Quickly rushing in, you cast a basic spell to at least try to keep yourself alive and throw yourself in front of the coming flame, "Parvus Pelta!" pushing Thanatos out of the way in the progress.

As the fire erupted from Flamming's maw, you screamed in agony as the fire came upon your shield. Though you stopped the flames from reaching you, the heat could not be halted and your clothing soon burst into flames. You expected to burn to death but as soon as the fire rushed out of his mouth, Flamming stopped it immediately. You were still badly burned and soon blacked out from the pain. The last thing you saw was Thanatos standing over you, tears rushing down his tiny face.

When you finally came to, you were lying in a bed of soft leaves. Not much remained of your clothing as it had burned off in the heat and the stumps on your back were clearly showing. The burns were the worst pain you had ever felt in your life. The fire might as well have been still there. Looking closer you thanked the heavens that they were no worse than second degree but cursed them for the pain they still caused.

A soothing liquid began pouring onto the burns, removing much of the pain and healed all the burns to a small degree. The worst that were minor burns and blisters. You looked up to see the healer and it was none other than Fenrir holding a barrel in his maw tilting it to let some liquid heal the remainder of your wounds.

You quickly rose from bed, startling him. "Where is Thanatos?!?! Is he OK?!?!"

"Do not worry rider, He is waiting for you outside." relieved you remembered why you came to see him in the first place.

"Fenrir, You keep calling me 'rider'. What is a rider anyway?"

"I suppose your people would not remember. Our peoples were once allies many years ago Trent. These alliances were only formed because of our pact with the riders of old, The Rector Draco, or Drecs as some called them. Ever since a betrayal within the Drecs, No rider has since then been seen."

"Wait, 'Drecs'? There is no such thing. Not even in legend is there any recollection of Rect... whatever they were called!"

"As there wouldn't be. The Betrayal took place over one thousand years ago." Shocked at the last statement, you knew it could be nothing other than false.

"Then what about now. Why are there no new 'Drecs' in the world. There are plenty of both races."

"After the Betrayal the humans and dragons parted ways for all eternity and left These lands, or so we planned. They made a mistake and after leaving, never told anyone about what happened between the two races. All was fine until some 300 years ago when our races met again. Fearing the presence of these dangerous creatures, the humans where always wary of our presence. It only took one small mistake to break out this great 20 year war. Since the time of our separation, no new Rector Draco pact was made for what the humans have caused. Until now."

"But I can't be a Drec, I am only raising Thanatos, I am not controlling him!"

"You and I both know that the connection you share with Thanatos is more than just friendly. Besides the proof is easily recognizable. Those 'wings' on your back will soon be full-size and look just like Thanatos's, as were all Dragoon pairs."

"What?! Wings?! I am going to grow wings?! And how could you know all this? You said yourself it happened over a thousand years ago!"

"Yes, that is only one of the changes you will undergo. Your other questions must wait however. Sleep now, you have been through much and need to recover." As he finished your mind seemed to obey his command as you could not keep your eyes open any longer and drifted into a deep sleep.

(A.N. Parvus Pelta: Minor Shield(non-elemental spell))
11311121111112.title: Recovery and Truth

choices: Stay in the Cave for once
113111211111121.content:
As you awoke the next day, you were relieved to find the soreness was completely gone. You quickly reached out with your mind to find Thanatos and it did not take long. He was right next to you after all...

"Thank God you woke up! I thought you were going to sleep forever!" He squealed, obviously happy to see you.

"How long have I been out?"

"Almost two days. That bastard almost killed you, and I couldn't do anything about it, I could only watch as you were nearly burned alive. I am so sorry Trent..."

"Don't you say things like that. There was no way you could have survived that flame. I was the only one who could cast a spell in time and there was no way I would let him harm you."

"But couldn't you have cast a spell on me instead of rushing in and shielding me? I may still be young, but my hide has grown strong."

"I wouldn't have risked it even if you were ten feet taller than me. A direct hit from that flame can incinerate anything, even you, unless properly protected with a spell. To bad I didn't have time to use one huh." Though you meant for humor, none was found and you both sat in silence finding comfort in each others presence.

"Hey, where did Fenrir go?" you asked, trying to change the subject.

"He went to deal with that poor excuse for a dragon. Probably flaming him now so he knows what it feels like" A vicious look was upon Thanatos's face as he spoke his anger. "And he deserves every minute of it for what he did to you!" About this time you noticed a rustle in the trees outside you window and noticed what seemed like a red flash through the opening. Hmm... more than likely a bird, damn nuisance they are...

"Now, now, he was only doing what he thought was best for his people. Though he did wrong in trying to harm you, I think he regrets what he did and we shall probably see him apologize to us even if it is forced upon him to do so."

"OK, but if he tries anything like that ever again, don't hesitate to kill him for me."

"Don't worry about that. When will Fenrir be back?"

"Soon... I think..."

"Should we wait here then?"
113111211111121.title: Time with Thanatos

1131112111111211.content:
You decide to stay in the tree-cave this time. You were weakened from the previous attack and you would be hard pressed to stop another attack. You barely held off the other attack at full strength.

You waited for about four hours sitting and chatting with Thanatos. He thought it immensely fun to prod your stubby wings and unfortunately nothing would seem to shake him off from his 'fun'.

The hard sound of wings soon erupted from outside. Knowing who it was you sat as upright as you could to better greet Fenrir. Only it wasn't Fenrir, but instead the once beautiful fire, now to you it looked as if the blaze would soon dissipate and die. Flamming had indeed looked better.

Thanatos quickly jumped in between when Fenrir came in behind Flamming, gesturing toward your friend to move aside. He agreed, albeit reluctantly. Flamming eyed you with none of the fury he once had. Only shame filled his eyes now. His speech only emphasized his shame further.

"I acted as a fool. Blind in my rage toward your kind, I almost killed one of my own... I thank you for saving him and am sorry for my actions. What I have done is unforgivable..." He spoke in a hushed tone, nearly a ghost of his former self. More than likely because he had been relayed your so called "Drec" status.

"I'll forgive you. You were only thinking of your own people and their safety. Thanatos however is not as easy to convince. You will need to prove it with him I am afraid."

Baring his teeth slightly, he spoke up once again, "Whatever I can do to make up for my travesty, I will do for you Thanatos, I am sorry."

"We shall see, The young one stated bluntly, "We shall see..."

"You have my word." and he began to stalk toward the doorway. Before he made it out however, his little one flew in through the window and began to speak,

"Sorry for what my dad did, he can be a bit aggressive sometimes but you get used..."

"BLAZE! Get home before i take you there myself! Harshly!" Flamming roared nearly reclaiming his lost fury. With a quick yelp he flew back out the window but not before throwing a friendly nod toward Thanatos's way.

A bit stunned by this, you returned your gaze to Thanatos who held what you would suspect as the same expression as yours.
1131112111111211.title: The Apology

11311121111112111.content:
Since the incident with Flamming, the dragons were now treating you differently. Either if it was out of respect of your rider status, that you risked your life to protect a fellow dragon, or for fear of what Fenrir would do to them if they tried something, you couldn't say. All in all you were relieved that you didn't have to worry about becoming flame broiled from behind anymore.

It had taken some time to get used to your winglets, especially when putting your clothing on. Thanatos still laughed at the thought of your expression when you found you could flap and flex them. Well how was I supposed to know they worked, I thought them only for show.

It had now been about a month and a half since you had rescued Thanatos and once again you noticed just how big he had gotten. Sure you heard stories about their quick growth, but this was insane! In less than half a year he had become nearly half your size. No doubt he would grow bigger seeing all the other dragons in the area. Fenrir explained that in their first year of life, a dragon undergoes a large growth spurt in which he will become about 9 feet tall in height. This lasts until his second year of life. The speed of growth then slows to about a foot a year then around the age of ten slows again to a foot every five years. Though the process continually slows with age, dragons continue to grow until the day they die. Judging Fenrir's hight at about 42 feet, according to him he would be about 100 years old, but probably even older since he said the process continues to slow.

Out of curiosity you blurt out, "So how old are you anyway?"

"I have passed 573 summers little one. How else would I hold such knowledge of the days of old." Staggering back slightly you could not help but believe him. He knew to much about the past and his eyes looked as if they had seen much more than any could imagine.

"So if dragons can live that long, then will Thanatos be all alone when I'm gone...?" You felt a shiver run down your spine that was not yours alone, but also from Thanatos's reaction to the question.

Fenrir let out a soft chuckle then turned to you both reassuringly and said, "No, no, you shall both be together as long as you both live, for a dragon gives his rider many gifts, a few being a dragon's worth of a lifetime and of coarse the wings you now have on your back."

Both of you sighed a relief then comforted each other in your thoughts which was now second nature, almost along the lines of breathing. You couldn't live without air and you couldn't live without Thanatos.

You spend the rest of the day talking with the local dragons and spending time with your life long friend.
11311121111112111.title: The Welcome Calm

113111211111121111.content:
The months began to go by quickly in the forest. Thanatos, now about 1/2 year old, was about 4 and a half feet tall. Only a couple feet shorter than you. You raised Thanatos the best you could, with the help of Fenrir of coarse. After the scuffle with Flamming, Blaze began to visit quite often. At first this annoyed Thanatos to no end but after some time, they became quite friendly with each other. Though even with his new friendship, He never left your side for a second. He followed you everywhere and you did the same.

One day when you were practicing your magic, which seemed much easier since the... attack, you were pulled away by Thanatos, curiosity obviously brimming from his look. "I've been wondering Trent, can I use this... magic stuff?"

You stared, amused by his curiosity, then said, "Well, why don't we find out shall we?"

"Find out? How?"

"Just listen and do exactly what I say alright?"

"Alright..."

"O.K. first, clear your mind of everything around you." checking his thoughts to make sure he had done so, you picked a leaf from the ground. "When I say, repeat the words 'Attolo Adverto' and concentrate on this leaf to lift it off of my hand and bring it to your claw. Don't create any stray thoughts, only think about the leaf. ONLY the leaf! got it?"

"Yes sir!" An excited tone now squeaking in his new deep voice.

"Alright... NOW!!!"

Thanatos's eyes shut hard, he was obviously concentrating on the leaf. From the looks of it, he was struggling with something, you couldn't tell if he was coming close to doing it or struggling with something else, when suddenly,
113111211111121111.title: Magic!!!

1131112111111211112.content:
Sweat began trickling down his hide and veins were bulging from his neck. He really wanted to move that leaf! Yet unfortunately, He seemed unable to do what you asked.

You thought that since he was a "magical" creature he could do magic but it seems as if that is not the case.

Damn! why won' it move!!" yelled Thanatos, quite angry at his failure.

"Well, I guess you may not be able to use magic. Besides, If you learned magic, why would you even need me by your side anymore." You said jokingly, but it struck a chord from Thanatos.

"IF ONLY TO PROTECT YOU MORE YOU IDIOT!!! How are you supposed to protect yourself when you are casting a spell, hmmm? the enemy would see an opening and you would be easy prey!" You only shook your head.

"So if you learned magic you could protect me then hmmm? What about yourself? You would also be an open target for them, and most likely you would be their main target anyways. Besides, how could you protect me while casting a spell?"

"Then why even teach me magic?!"

"Hey, you were the one who wanted to learn, besides it wasn't a bad idea. If you are ever alone without me, you may need it. Since you already have the attack thing down with your claws, teeth and soon to be fire breath, you only should need to learn my defensive spells."

"But if I can't then what's the point?"

"Well you have me there... maybe Fenrir could help us out? It's worked before."

" Well, what about you? Shouldn't you practice your attack spells or maybe even weapon skills."

"Yeah, I guess your right ha ha. How can i teach you things when i barely know what the hell I'm doing. Like you already know, I just started learning this stuff about 1 month before you were born."

"So it's settled then, I'll help you with your magic training!"

Taken back slightly, you quickly respond, "Huh? Ha ha what made you come up with that idea out of the blue?"

"He did!" Confused you looked behind you where Thanatos was pointing his wing only to see,
1131112111111211112.title: So close

11311121111112111121.content:
Looking behind you you find the same green giant that brought you into this forest, Fenrir.

"So, you want to become more powerful do you? Why would you want to do that now that you have a dragon by your side? It seems as if you have enough do you not?" Those words made you simmer slightly in your seat. 'How could he say that when dragons were being killed left and right', but from the tone of his voice you could tell the meaning was different.

"You know that only one dragon isn't enough to protect against all threats. I made a promise with his father to protect him and that is what i will do. I can't protect him though if I can't even protect myself." you vaguely glanced at your new scars from the previous incident. Thanatos quietly nuzzled your arm which gave you the strength to continue the conversation."And that is why I'm am now asking for your help. Will you train me Fenrir? I am not sure if you can but right now you are my best bet heh heh."

Seeming to mull over this, Fenrir lifted his gaze up toward the ceiling and pulled his right claw up to his upturned chin. Then, apparently done thinking, he turned and began out the doorway. You and Thanatos were struck down. 'what will we do now...' you thought simultaneously. As you slumped in your chair, Fenrir used this moment to turn his head slightly and speak.

"Meet me in the open field in the center of the forest at noon tomarow. Make sure you eat a good meal, you'll need the energy. Both of you." And he quickly took off leaving you and Thanatos sitting in a daze. That was quickly thrown off by shouts of joy all heard by the retreating form of the smiling green giant.
11311121111112111121.title: Dragonic Training

113111211111121111211.content:
You awoke early the next morning to a snoring Thanatos. Chuckling, you decided not to wake him and go to find something to make for breakfast. Unfortunately, it seemed that a kitchen went unneeded by the dragons. This hollowed out 'Tree cave' was just that. No extra furnishings were in sight other than a raised platform acting as the bed. Dragons never seemed the type to be cooped up indoors all the time so it did make some sense.

Dismayed at the lack of food you went to wake your partner. This did not take much time since the little guy apparently slept lightly when excited. With barely a nudge to his side he leaped out of the bed ready to go and nearly flung his scaled head right into your chest. He quickly apoligized and began his youthful rambling about what we were going to learn today. How he ever got the idea he'd be able to destroy a mountain is beyond you.

"Well what are we waiting for? He said to be at the grounds by noon and the yellow circle is almost at the top of the sky!" Sighing at his antics, you tried to calm him down.

"First of all, it's the sun. Not the yellow circle, and we still haven't eaten. Remember Fenrir's instructions? It sounded like he would work us pretty hard."

"But we'll be late if we don't head down their now. Besides I'm not that hungry. We both had a lot of food last night and we should be fine. How hard could it be?"

"I don't know buddy, he seemed pretty serious."

"Fine then, you decide but don't blame me if we get in trouble for it.

"Well then, I guess we'll...
113111211111121111211.title: The training begins...

choices: Flamming and Blaze come into the picture
1131112111111211112111.content:
"Well then, i guess we'll grab some grub"

"Eeeewww...now i know you don't like grubs Trent..."

Laughing, You explain, "I meant, lets get some food. It's a phrase my friend used to say--"

"Oh you remember that do you?"

Shocked, you just sit their. You couldn't believe it. Could this honestly be my long-time lost friend from Parcel? Spinning around you saw two things. One, your actual partner, Thanatos, charging at the newcomer. second, this 'newcomer' WAS infact Felix Brombard standing in front of the tree of your home.

Noticing he wasn't moving out of the way of Thanatos's charge, you tried to call out to him, but it was too late. Thanatos was already there! Felix however saw him coming and ducked down leaving Thanatos to crash headfirst into the tree.

Felix just cracked a smile and said with a heavy breath, "Whoa, that was close, nearly got me there small fry!" Thanatos was dazed from hitting the tree so he didn't catch the joke, but what he was thinking was clear. The thoughts of confusion almost overwhelmed you. You couldn't help but snicker slightly. The poor little guy, you decided it would be better to explain it to him quickly that...

"TRENT! THANATOS!" oh boy.You knew that voice...you were in for it. Fenrir came through the trees into the spot.What confused you, however, was the feeling of relief he had. Wait, didn't he hate humans? Wait a minute... WHY IS FELIX HERE IN THE FIRST PLACE!!!

"I guess you already met Felix then." Fenrir said. Oh boy... I'm guessing some explaining is in order! Well, so much for grabbing some food...
1131112111111211112111.title: New arrival

11311121111112111122.content:
You turned to see who Thanatos had mentioned. Thanatos was obviously suffering to Fenrir standing outside but a more noticeable figure blocked your view. Thanatos was also startled by the new presence and came in between you and the newcomer. Never did you expect the man who stood there. More importantly was that it was a MAN who stood there. 'How did he get into the forest without Fenrir seeing him?!'

'He didn't.' came Fenrir's all to powerful voice from outside. 'You would be surprised at how close both of your stories are in comparison. Only difference being he did not bond.'

Startled by the truth, you looked the man over carefully. Something seemed oddly familiar about this man. "What, you don't even recognize your old pal Trent?" Realization struck you so hard you nearly fell backward.

"Felix? Felix Brombard?! How the hell did you get here?!" Felix was your old friend from Parcel. You both could use magic, though he was what they called an attack mage. Had a nearly frightening love for fire type magic as well.

"Well when we were taken from Parcel to join the army, I was sent off to a militia to destroy an enemy base, or say they told me. Once I arrived I found out it was a family cave." Fenrir was right. Your stories were very similar. "I couldn't do it Trent, not to a helpless family. When they all attacked, I could only watch helplessly. Almost every one of the men were killed and the entire family went with them. Even the children... It was a massacre..." A shudder going up your spine, That could have been Thanatos if it wasn't for me...

"When they killed the last dragon... I just lost it. I don't remember anything that happened during that time except when I came to all of them were dead..."

Fenrir then stepped in, "That was my doing. I heard the dragons cries and rushed in as fast as I could, but I was too late to save them. I would have killed young Felix here as well, but he reminded me to much of you... A wizard that refused to kill. He did not lay a hand on one dragon but also did not help the ones in need." Felix flinched at this statement as if just realizing it himself. "He didn't even speak when I attempted to communicate. In fact he only just started talking a couple days ago."

"What? how long ago did this happen?"

"Just over a month ago. He has been kept away from everyone for his protection."

"What?! Why the hell didn't you tell me he was here!?"

"And how was I to know that he was your friend hmm? I may be a dragon but I do not stoop to reading minds no matter the case and as I said before he has kept silent until a few days ago. Once he mentioned Parcel I realized you might have known him."

"He speaks the truth Trent." Came Felix's voice to your surprise.

"Wait, you can understand him?"

"Yeah I guess, Why? Aren't you able too?"

"Well yes but, I thought it was because of Thanatos's and my... connection."

"Connection? What are you talking about?" Looking toward Fenrir, and then to Thanatos, they both give a nod of approval. You release a long sigh and begin to retell your own adventure from being taken from parcel all the way to where you are now.

"Wow... And I thought I went through hell. This would be hard to take in if were anyone else but you, I can trust old fre.. fre..." He started looking off behind you stuttering all the while.

"What? What the hell are you staring at?"

As if your voice brought him back to reality, he jumped and pointed a long finger toward your new wings and screamed, "WHAT THE HELL ARE THOSE!!!"

"Oh man, I almost forgot. Felix this is my dragon, Thanatos," Thanatos bowed in a greeting, "and well, gods how do I explain this. Well since me and him have... bonded I guess you could call it, I have grown these. Trust me, I don't know much more about it than you. Fenrir behind you is the one who has been telling me what's going on so he would be the one to ask." Looking toward Fenrir he nodded slowly still in a mild shock. Thanatos took this opportunity to approach him.

"Nice to meet you Felix. I've heard many things about you from Trent." He began retelling some tales excitedly and Felix just stared on with a slightly perplexed gaze. Thanatos would not relent so it seemed you had to go and relieve your friend of your talkative companion.

"Heh heh, alright Than, leave him alone for a bit. He has enough to think about besides reminiscing about the past." Showing some relief at the small dragon relenting and taking his place beside you again, Felix relaxed a bit.

"So what does this 'bond' mean? What are you just friends with him or something?"

"I would say a bit more, but it's difficult to explain why. All I know is if he was gone I don't think I could go on."

"Same here Trent." This only seemed to confuse him even more as he stepped backward rubbing his temple as if he had a large headache.

"I believe that questions should be saved for a later time. I think your friend would like some time alone to think through everything that he has been told." Both you and Felix nod and Fenrir leads him out the door toward his home.

Well that was unexpected, wouldn't you say Than?

"Do you really need to ask? He looked as if he was thrown into another realm."

"Well in a way he was, but all that matters is he is safe. I can't believe I was able to see him again."

"I can't wait to play some of our ga-" Before he was able to finish you both heard Blaze calling from just outside your home. He just came into view after rounding a tree and was sprinting toward you. Felix and Fenrir had not left yet slightly startled by the newcomer.

Thanatos! You ready to explore some more around the edges of the forest? I found so-" He stopped mid-sentence once he spotted Felix. He craned his neck upward as his eyes enlarged. It even looked as if his scales shimmered with an even more vivid red than usual. Felix was in the same stupor with eyes wide gazing at Blaze. As if rehearsed before hand, they both blurt out in sync,

"Blaze?"
"Felix?"
"How did you know my..."
"How did you know my..."

You, Thanatos and Fenrir all came to a realization at that point,

Things just became a lot more complicated.
11311121111112111122.title: An old freind

113111211111121111221.content:
You, Fenrir, and Thanatos were not the only ones who came to a sudden realization, but Flamming had witnessed the entire scene and also saw the connection between his son and Felix. The large, red dragon had watched from a distance the exchanges between the two humans without desiring to interfere but now, his nostrils flared and a nervous flex in his wings caused scales to rub against each other.

Flamming had made some horrible mistakes in judging the characters of Trent and Thanatos and he was deeply sorry for being so closed minded to the wonderful possibility of a new rider. But two new riders? Why are things happening so fast and why must his son be involved? He owed a great debt to Thanatos and was determined to prove himself to the Little One. Even though Trent forgave him he still felt as though he owed the human a debt as well. But this was his son who was in the beginning stages of bonding with a complete human stranger and it made Flamming a little nervous for Blaze’s safety.

Back claws dug into the earth and he spread his wings from the concealed, hidden spot and with one powerful pump of his wings he leapt into the air and glided over to the scene. He positioned himself in between the line of sight of Felix and Blaze, landing with a steady stance and angled his triangular head so that his large eyes pierced into Felix’s vision.

Felix stammered backwards a few steps. He had to crane his head upwards to take in the majesty of this full-grown dragon. He thought that Blaze was beautiful with those shimmering red scales, but this larger dragon was red as well and his scales danced like gems in the raging flames of fire. Felix was swept away in emotions of awe and had no time to feel frightened of Flammings presence.

You and Thanatos, however, both felt your muscles tense up at Flammings entrance. You had both witnessed the fury of this dragon before and started to reminisce those memories. You began to prepare for a protection spell in case something dangerous happened, and hopefully you will have enough time to weave together one of adequate strength to prevent any burns. But although Flamming had abruptly burst into the scene, he did not carry those threatening signs of attack. His wings folded up completely and teeth were kept hidden behind those lizard-like lips and his massive muscles seemed relaxed enough to never indicate a violent strike was coming.

Flammings thoughts boomed into everyone who could hear, “Blaze, go home.”

“But daddy I want to talk to Felix!” The tiny creature started to shift his feet so that he could step around the looming presence of his dad and view the intriguing human once again.

“I said go home! You have played enough today. You better mind me or I will remind you what it is like to disobey your father!”

Blaze was clearly upset, but the little dragon seemed to hesitate even farther not wanting to leave the presence of Felix.

“You cannot stop the inevitable from happening Flamming.” Fenrir’s voice came wise and gentle. Even though Blaze and Felix may not understand the hidden meaning, the rest of them knew that Fenrir was indicating to the bond that was beginning to take shape between the two.

You saw how Flamming’s tale whipped in reflex from the agitated emotions it was experiencing only to land still near the form of his child. He craned his neck upwards even straighter and rested his bottle-like orbs upon Fenrir, “How can you trust a human you hardly know? Felix may harbor evil in his heart and turn my son into a dragon for the worse. You know as good as I that the hearts of red dragons are easily swayed to either good or evil. I will not take the chance of my son becoming evil.” Then, Flamming turned his head to see his son once again, “I said go home. I will not say it again.”
113111211111121111221.title: Flamming Fears His Sons Future

1131112111111211112212.content:
"No dad, I'm not leaving, not yet at least. Felix is different than Trent and I have to know why." Blaze stood there resiliently, however his body was quivering slightly. You assumed he had never stood up to his father before and who were you to blame him. Flamming had quite a commanding aura about him.

Flamming's eyes widened slightly at his sons remark. This must be the first time he has ever disobeyed him. A staring match insued between father and son for another ten minutes. No words spoken, no sound made, no movement save for Blaze's slight shivering under his father's weathering gaze. Soon however, his gaze softened ever so slightly. Lowering his stance he lets out a defeated sigh.

It was the second time you saw his scales lose their beautiful glow. Only his eyes continued to shimmer as he finally spoke to his son.

"If this is what you want Blaze my boy, fine I wont stop you." Curling his lip slightly at the end and finalizing it with a nod, Blaze beemed at his father's acceptance. As quickly as it had left though, his scales flared to life once again with the angry fury you remembered. His gaze locked with a panic stricken Felix. They remained like that for another few minutes and only stopped when Felix gulped down harshly and nodded weakly. I... guess that was a warning. Man I wouldn't want to be Felix right now heh heh... you mention to Thanatos. Unable to fully understand, he only weekly nods, his gaze following the red giant out the door. His head lowered more than usual, even since he attacked you. Feeling a need to say something to him, you speak up,

"Hey, Flamming. So you know, I'll make sure to keep Felix in line. He wont do anything to hurt any of us. I've known him as long as I can remember." Finally getting his voice as well, Thanatos joins you,

"Yeah that's right, and even if he did we will protect Blaze with our lives. Right Trent?"

"You got it buddy." Smiling once again at your small partner's ever cheerful attitude. It seemed to work however, as Flamming nodded and spoke once more before finally exiting.

"You have done much for us rider. I will take that to heart. One day I will repay this debt I owe you that seems to continue to grow each time I encounter you." Stating the last bit with a hint of sarcasm, he disappears into the leaves. Looking back over toward Blaze and Felix they seemed to be continuing there stare contest with new vigor. Fenrir just waited patiently to the side.

"Well Than, what should we do? Want to interupt whatever there talking about and make sure this is true or you want to talk with Fenrir?"
1131112111111211112212.title: Young ones strength

11311121111112111122121.content:
Thanatos was thoughtful for a moment with his gaze intently watched both Felix and Blaze. After a length he witnessed calm but curious demeanor's settle into the muscles of their friends and he was certain that they should let the two have their moment of privacy. The black dragon looked back towards you with his silver eyes brimming in questions of his own.

As if your mind was one with Thanatos’ you immediately knew the answer without needing to hear a response. Like individual branches of a tree, both you and Thanatos were linked in such a way that you could easily dip into the main trunk and know what the other was thinking. And as every day flew by in the protected shelter of the nesting grounds it became easier and easier to do such a thing. You gave your dragonling a nod…understanding that the both of you had questions that only Fenrir could answer.

Turning with the opal dragon on your heels, you both end up in front of that older dragon who had taken you under his wing. Fenrir was a shade of forest green; scales dancing in the various greenish-hues of the color spectrum to complete a facade of warm life. This gentle warmth though could be quickly misleading as you had discovered the first day you met him. The three rows of spines running along his impressive back from head to tail were daringly sharp and his wings were nothing but extraordinary symbols of his strength and vigor. You suddenly realized that you admired him as both a friend and mentor and you were glad that he was on your side.

“Fenrir,” you exclaimed, “another dragon rider! It has been so long since dragon riders have flourished in existence and now there are two of us! It is happening so fast! For this to happen now... it seems so unreal. What does this mean?” You asked the question that was boiling inside of both you and Thanatos.

Fenrir cocked his head downwards to gaze upon your form. His words filtered into your mind in a manner like your friends back home would converse with you out in the open. “It means both wonderful and terrible things are going to happen, Rider. It foretells the coming of awesome events that will shake the foundations of Shoven.” The triangular shaped head of Fenrir lowered to gaze more intently upon you and Thanatos at eye level. “Make sure you adhere to your training and learn all you can learn about each other. Know each other’s strengths and weaknesses and know how powerful you are when combined together. You will need this knowledge for the near future because it may mean a matter of life and death for the both of you. There will come times of great sadness that you both must endure but take heart, it is only fleeting, because you will experience and taste a life of happiness as well. Great responsibility will be thrust upon your shoulders but together you can, and must, overcome any obstacle that presents itself. Trent, you and Felix mark the beginning of a new era and quite possibly the fate of Shoven will rest upon the backs of you Riders.”

You were suddenly aware of the many blinks your eyelids took in action over your eyes. You were not expecting an answer like this. It excited and scared you at the same time and no doubt Thanatos felt the same way as you. Apparently, there was room for more reality to settle into your awareness of how important you and Felix had become in the thrall of political and powerful factions across the known land. Fenrir was convinced that you, a common trader's son, would rise to these spoken words that seemed like prophecies and already you have felt the thrust of fate pulling you along this very course even when nothing of the sort has ever happened. You were left speechless.

Seeming content with his speech, Fenrir left you both to ponder his words for the night. He may have answered your first question, but his answer left you with infinite possibilities for the future. However, it was just that, the future, and no questions he gave could be answered about that unpredictable train of thought. No more to do than to sleep on it and that is just what you and the little one did.
11311121111112111122121.title: It means both wonderful and terrible things...

113111211111121111221211.content:
Waking up before Than as usual, you began preparing some leftovers from yesterdays dinner. Once finished it wasn't long before the little one was awoken by the smell and you both feasted on the morning meal with nary a word between you. Once finished, you both made your way to the training area that Fenrir specified. It was a very quiet treck to the grounds. Thanatos and you both having a lot on your minds kept any words between you to yourselves. The feelings playing across your mental link was enough to show the other what they were thinking.

Upon arriving neither of you were surprised to see Felix and Blaze their as well. Thanatos was actually anticipating this so training wouldn't be so boring.

"So I take it that Fenrir has you training here as well eh Felix?" you said with a playful mock to your voice.

"If that's what you call it. I know he can teach the dragon's some things, but how is he supposed to teach us anything? He's a dragon. Last I checked they didn't use magic." This made a lot of sense. How was Fenrir supposed to teach you magic. He said himself dragons were unable to use it so why would he say he would teach it. 'Well he hasn't lied to us yet, no reason not to trust him. I wonder how he will do it though.'

"If he said he will, he will. If any dragon could do it i'm pretty sure he could. It's as if he has knoledge that even he does not know of. Did you see his eyes? I've never seen that shade of silver before." You and Than had always been mystified by his eyes. They seemed to have so much depth yet all was perfectly hidden behind the beautiful color.

"I never really paid it any mind. A person's, or rather beings, actions always tell more about them then any eye could."

"It doesn't really matter anyway. Were all here now so let's just make the most of it."Blaze chimed in with a mischivious glint in his eye.

"I know that look. It's one of my favorites. What are you planning this time eh?" Thanatos spoke, finally bringing his voice to the conversation.

"Come on you guys, I already had to have my entire life reversed in under one week and on top of that you woke me up early. Can't you give me a break today?" Felix said, obviously not amused at this turn of events.

Should you take Felix's side and stop their plot before they get the entire forest after them, or should you just let it play out. It's not like thier "evil" plots ever hurt anyone before.
113111211111121111221211.title: The next day

choices: He stays back in the brush with you
1131112111111212.content:
"No lets go explore. When you were sleeping I found an interesting clearing in the forest, it had what looked like scorch marks on the ground." Thanatos suggested. You have to admit that is a bit strange, a clearing with scorch marks on the ground. Could it be a battle ground, and If so for who?

"Alright, it sounds interesting, lets go have a look." You push yourself off the ground as Thanatos trots behind you quietly.

You both walk out the door and into the fresh forest air. Stretching your back, you look over to Thanatos, "So, which way is the clearing?" he nods in the direction that leads off onto the forest. "This way, come on, hurry!" He trots off down the path. You smile to yourself, he's always full of energy, then jog off after him.

After a few minutes of walking, talking through your mental link about this and that, Thanatos suddenly stops "Whats wrong Than?"
"The clearing is just around that corner," he nods ahead where the path takes a sharp turn. "but i think we should sneak through the forest," he says nodding towards the forest. "you know, so we don't scare anyone off." He shows some of his teeth and starts to jump slightly from the ground, this is like a game of hide and seek for him."Sure, good idea." If only I knew a spell to mask noise. I should ask Fenrir about it.

You soon notice the trees start to thin out then come to an abrupt halt, they both creep up behind a large bush which defines the edge of the clearing. As you look through the branches you see that Thanatos was right, the are many odd, crescent shaped scorch marks opposed to the usual teardrop shape usually seen with a dragons fire and several large ditches scar the otherwise pristine clearing, and large gouges cover the surrounding trees. "Your right Thanatos, there was definately a battle here."

"And it looks like more is about to occur." he states back pointing a wing towards the edges of the clearing. You move a branch aside to reveal a familiar looking red dragon, and another unfamiliar silver dragon squaring off in the clearing.

"Shouldn't we stop them from fighting?"

"How? By jumping between them and using some small spell again? I wont let you. Besides, I think this is just sparring."

Heh, looks like the little guy is growing up protecting me like that. We'll make a great team. Wait, did he say sparring? THIS is sparring!?

You look again at the grounds with a cautious eye. Flamming had looked better. His once blazing scales had dimmed considerably and many were scraped or cut with dirt lining the entirety of his body. Pushing any reasoning for this in the back of your mind until later, he and the new dragon begin to circle each other before the silver dragon begins to speak. Either they didn't care to be private or did not know that others were present

"Flamming-elda, what would you like to work on next?"

Flamming visibly sighs, "Please Jirda, that title never fits me and you know it, especially now. We have been friends since we were small and still you name me as you would your father."

"I'm sorry, but as a guardian I cannot change our customs... Flamming-elda" You notice his name was spoken with some amusement from the now named Jirda.

"Why you... fine, just a basic spar. And before you say something I wont use my fire, honestly every time you ask and every time you will receive the same answer."

"This should be fun." Thanatos states to you slyly.

Oh crap, what's he up to now?

11311121111112121.content:
"Come on Trent. Lets go mess with Flamming." Whispered Thanatos crouching down ready to spring into the clearing.

"Are you sure jumping between two fighting dragons is a good idea?" You whisper back. you're not sure about the proper etiquette when Interrupting a dragon's sparring match. aww hell it's not like Flamming could dislike you anymore. You grin to yourself, Thanatos was right this would be fun. "So what do you think we should do? Walk out, announce our intentions then go for him?"

"Sounds good to me. I'll handle offense. Can you give me support?" He replied softly. Gently bouncing up and down on his haunches. Seems like he's looking forward to a good fight. Come to think of it this is the first time we would actually be in combat together.

OK so the opponents probably not going to use fire, well at least you hope not. So you'll just have to deal with his strength, claws and fangs. Ferrum Tergum should protect Thanatos against . But what should you use as a diversion? Nothing lethal but it needs to be scary looking. Terra Culmen rushing past his face should grab his attention.

You look over at Thanatos a part of you hoping that you're not about to make a big mistake. "Alright. On three we walk out together. one two three." on three you push aside the bushes and walk boldly into the clearing Thanatos bounding ahead of you. Both Flamming and Jirda stop and look round at you. A mixture of surprise and mild annoyance on Flamming's features . While Jirda looks from you to Thanatos to your growing wings. unhidden curiosity on his face.

You both nod politely at Jirda, who nods back in reply. No point being rude to a new dragon. Then turn you attention to Flamming and Thanatos calls out "Flamming we request a sparring match against you." You nod in agreement. Flamming just cocks his head and looks you straight in the eye.

Does Flamming accept?
