113111211111121212.content:
Flamming stares at you for a second longer, apparently deciding if he should accept or not. "Fine. I accept." His tone remaining neutral, “Our rules are simple, draw blood, win. Moreover, avoid killing your opponent, its generally frowned upon. How you draw blood is your choice. Begin on three.

“Uh oh, Thanatos you’re going to have to use your claws to scratch him. I don’t have the aim to cut through his scales without seriously hurting him.” you whisper to Thanatos. Though it is good that you have been looking into the note that the militia gave you to practice spells. Recently you have been able to learn three more.

He chuckles. Flexing his claws “If you can keep his attention on you for a few seconds and I should be able to give him a nice scar"
“Thanatos," you warn, “be careful that you don't do something you'll regret later. “
"Three!” Flamming calls. Oops, you did not even notice him start counting. At three Flamming starts running straight towards you. His footsteps booming throughout the clearing, you wait until he is only a few feet away. Then you raise your hands and yell "Terra Culmen" suddenly a large tower of earth shoots up from the ground in front of Flamming. Surprising him and causing him to take a few steps back. Only to be hit from the side by Thanatos as he jumped at him, attempting to gain purchase on his side and dig his claws in. Nevertheless, Flamming managed to shake than loose and propel himself backwards with a few beats of his powerful wings, the blast of wind nearly knocking you off your feet. Thanatos being a fair bit heavier than you was not bothered much by the wind. When Flamming lands he is several meters away from you. He looks from you to Thanatos and back again, more wary now. Waiting for us to make the first move.

Suddenly you hear Thanatos whisper "Trent I can't get through his hide. It is way too tough for my claws. Do you have any ideas?”
You do not think you have the accuracy to use a serious cutting attack like "Ventus Vesica.” You need something else, something more precise. You get a flash of inspiration, your water bottle. You should be able to make some sort of small non-lethal weapons out of them. "Thanatos I need you to jump at Flamming, but try to get away from him as soon as possible."


He glances at you and nods. I hope his trust in me is warranted. "When you’re ready Than."

Flamming looks about ready to take another shot when Thanatos leaps forward using his wings to gain a bit of extra speed. Flamming plants his claws and holds his ground. As Thanatos makes a flying charge at Flamming, you open your water bottle, draw the water out, and call "glacies postulo" shaping the water into several thin shapes, freezing them. Then sending them flying towards Flamming at high speed. Flamming saw Thanatos charge at him and countered by turning slightly and bringing his tail around to swipe at Thanatos. Who manages to jump over the blow and ram into Flamming open flank. At impact Thanatos shoves off and pushing Flamming off balance while sending himself in the other direction. Flamming stumbles to the side only to be hit in the other side by a flurry of small ice crystals. Many of which shatter harmlessly against his tough scales but one or two manage to penetrate, drawing the winning blood.

Flamming reaches up and brushes his side knocking the needles out. He straightens up and bows to you both. Panting you look to each other a pair of wide grins creeps onto your faces. You turn back to Flamming and bow in return. Then your observer Jirada breaks the silence with a load resounding applause. “Very good. Very good. So the legends about the riders are true. You, a young mage, and an even younger dragon actually beat Flamming. A bit of a close thing but still a victory. Aye Flamming?" Jirada proclaimed joyfully. Strangely happy to see Flamming beaten. Flamming looked at Jirada ruefully. Then replied “Yes, yes, you won. Congratulations. It seems like your very in tune and have a lot of potential. However, we are out of time and must take our leave. Good bye." And with a curt nod, he turns and leaves along a path out of the clearing. Jirada nods to you as well then follows. Chuckling to himself.

You and Thanatos look at each other again then burst out laughing. Thanatos rolls to the ground while you walk over to a tree and drop down in its shade. "Did you see Flamming's face when I dodged over his tail. He thought for sure he had gotten me. Then when those ice things hit him, He was sure annoyed!" Thanatos cried happily. "Well we certainly did well. Considering this is our first fight. Hope he doesn’t stay angry with us though." You reply also quite pleased with your performance. Neither of you could have taken on a full-grown dragon but you managed to beat him as a team.

Thanatos gets up and trots over to you. Lying down on the grass next to you. Then you both hear a loud grumbling. "Was that you or me?" asked Thanatos "Both I think. That fight was kind of taxing. Want to head home after we get something to eat? We can ask Fenrir about combat and magic training next time we see him." You reply. You are actually starving. You had not had a decent meal for a while. There should be a river somewhere nearby. "Sure c'mon I also found a lake nearby. It's where the dragons get their water and fish." He gets up and points towards the edge of the clearing, roughly south. You climb to you feet and follow him.

A short walk later, you reach the lake. Moreover, it is one of the most beautiful places you have seen. The water is a sparkling crystal blue and is backed by a series of tall snow capped mountains. All of which is surrounded by a thick green forest. "Wow." You gasp. “I know it's huge isn’t it.” Thanatos says. You chuckle yourself wondering at what age kids finally get the whole scenery thing. "Yeah it's pretty big. Must be a least a mile and a half wide. Do you want to build a fire while I try to catch some fish?" You ask Thanatos while rummaging around for the hooks and string you always keep in your rucksack. Another piece of survival gear from the militia. As Than goes off into the forest to look for wood you break off a suitable branch, attach the string, and hook to it. What to use for bait though? Wait you still had some preserved dear from you trip here. A bit old now but should make good bait. As you tear it into bits and hook one on the line, you hear Thanatos return. Dragging two large branches one in his mouth the other with his tail. He drops them on the ground and walks over to you. “Is that enough?” He asks. "Yeah, Looks like it should be plenty. Could you please dig a small hole and fill it with broken bits of those two logs?" you reply casting the hook into the water.

After about a minute of waiting, you get a bite and pull in a large fish. As you place it on the ground next to you Thanatos wanders over, having finished making the fire pit. “Hey, Nice catch.” He comments prodding the fish with his claw. "Yeah, The fish here seem to be pretty big." You reply putting another bit of meat on the hook and throwing it back in. "Hey Thanatos. Can you breathe fire?” You ask, looking over at him lying on the bank. He tilts his head and thinks. “I don't know. I have not tried before. Might as well give it a shot.” He rears back his head taking a deep breath then gives a strong exhalation. Surprisingly on the first try, a small plume of fire bursts from his lips. You put the rod in the crook of your arm and clap your hands. "Amazing on the first try too. Was it easy? How did it feel?" He blushes a bit. Well you think he did. "Yeah it was pretty easy. It almost felt natural. Doesn’t feel hot though. This is kind of surprising really." Suddenly the rod jerks. Nearly gets out of your grip. As you pull it in, you glance over at Thanatos and ask, "Do you want two? Or would you be happy with one?" It is another large fish. You place it next to the first. "If you could catch a third that would be great. I am pretty hungry. I'll go "light" the fire." He says. Walking over to the fire and using his breath to create a nice blaze. You put the last of the meat on the hook and throw it in again.

A few minutes later, you are both sitting by the fire waiting for the fish to cook. Then Thanatos sits up and asks you. “I’ve been wondering, The riders they haven’t been round for hundreds of year’s right?” You nod. “And you’re first in a long time right?” Another nod. “So what does that mean? Do we have some special job to do?” you shrug, "I've been thinking the same thing and I have no idea. I we all have our part to play in life. Nevertheless, we do not know what it is until the time comes. But, I guess Fenrir might be able to give us some clues, he seems knowledgeable in those kinds of things. Any way the fish it ready." You take the spit you rigged up from sticks and break it so that two fish are on one part and one on the other. Passing the one with two fish to Thanatos, he grabs it with both claws and starts munching away at them. You take a bite out of your own and look out over the lake. Wondering, what is in store for the pair of you?

1131112111111212121.content:
"YAWN" Thanatos yawned loudly as you sat against a large tree. Watching the sun set over the lake. Thanatos stretched his legs then got up and walked over to the lake and drank deeply. When he'd had his fill of water he came back over and looked at the sunset "C'mon Trent it's getting late, lets go home." You nod and push yourself up "Sure. We probably should get home before dark." You both walk in the direction of the village.

"Hey. Trent." Thanatos said. You glance over him.

"Yeah Thanatos?"

"Why do you cook your food? I mean it tastes fine how it is. And cooking it just wastes time."

"Umm. I think it's because uncooked meat makes us sick. We cant handle it. I guess Dragons are just more robust in that way."

As you reach your tree/cave Thanatos stops "So does that mean that humans are weaker that dragons?" Uh oh. How do I get out of this one. It was that kind of were better than you are attitude that starts conflicts "Well. You know how humans can use magic?" Than nods. "And dragons can't." another nod. "Its like that. There are things dragons can do that humans can't and there are things humans can do that dragons can't."

Thanatos just nods wisely. "So you mean that just because a dragon can fly and stuff dosn't mean he is any better than a human that can't?"
You sigh inwardly seems like he accepts the idea "Right."

You both walk inside. You drop your rucksack by the door and take off you shoes. "I'm beat. I think I'll go to bed. Good night Thanatos." Thanatos has walked over to the window. Well the small hole in the wall across the room from the door. And was staring up at the night sky. You walk up next to him. "Pretty beautiful isn't it." The sky is clear and the stars are sparkling like a million gems. "Yeah I wonder What those shiny things are?"
"Heh. Their called stars. Their like the sun only further away." Wow I guess your going to have to tell him all about the world. Heck you don't even know that much about the world. "But hey we have plenty of time to learn about that kind of thing. For know though. I'm getting some sleep."

You walk over to the bed. a kind of raised area of wood covered with a layer of straw . It was originally meant for a full size dragon so you and Thanatos easily fit on it. "Good night Trent." Thanatos calls "G'night." You yawn back. Stretching out on the bed were one end or another of a full grown dragon might lay. Almost as soon as your head touches the hay your out.

Early next morning you wake up with Thanatos curled next to you. Carefully so as to not wake him up you get off the bed and put you shoes on. then quietly walk over to the door way. Watching the dragons go about their morning business. A few nod to you in acknowledgment but most seem to be to busy to notice you. You hear a soft rustling behind you. Sounds like Thanatos is awake. you walk back inside to get some berries and fruit out of you rucksack.

Thanatos had just rolled onto his back and was still asleep. You sit up against the wall eat some odd orange berries you found in the forest and an apple. After you'd finished them Thanatos had still shown no signs of waking so you decided to go get some meat for breakfast.

You had to walk a few minutes before you got to a area that was populated by animals. You come across a small glen which seems to be the home for a large number of rabbits. You pick up a small pebble from the ground and whisper "calx offa." The stone flew from you hand and hit a rabbit in the head knocking it to the ground and killing it outright. The other rabbits scatter at the sudden movement. Hopping quickly to the safety of nearby bushes. You walk out into the glen and pick up the dead rabbit. Probably won't fill Thanatos up but should make a decent snack.

As if on cue you feel a rush of worry and hear Thanatos's voice call out "Trent. Were are you?" You start walking back in the direction you came holding the rabbit by its back legs. "Sorry Than. I just went out to the forest to get you some meat." You feel slightly ashamed at getting him so worried but at the same time feel a flush of affection. He really did care about you. "I'm coming back now. I should be there in a minute or two.

You arrive back home and pass the rabbit to Thanatos. "Next time wake me please." He said as he began eating the rabbit. In a few bites it was gone and Thanatos was licking his maw. He gets up and trots over to the entrance. "So what should we do today?" He asks you. "Hmmm. Good question" you reply. "What should we do today?"

11311121121.content:
Silver stares at you, one of his eyes covered by an eye-patch, his gaze made you nervous...

"So you are the new rider?" Silver says after a while.

"W-what?" Startled by his question. Fenrir just began to regain his footing and padded toward your group. It seemed his interest in you and Thanatos had vanished and he was now completely focused on this new visitor.

"Lets see shall we?" Silver said as he threw his blade to you. It was a very ornate scimitar with jewels encrusted along it's blade and hilt. The blade of pure silver and the hilt was a dark mahogany wood with a solid gold wrist guard.

"What am I meant to do with this?" you asked, still gazing at the beauty of the sword you held.

"Attack me." This statement made you forget the blade entirely and gawk at Silver. He had to be insane.

"Attack me in any fashion you want. Use the blade or if you prefer use your magic."

"B-But..." You stutter.

"Do it or I kill your dragon."
This hardened your heart instantly. No one would take Thanatos away from you. If he threatened him he forfeit his life. You decide to make sure this kid never threatened your partner. Delving into your magic you decide to break a well known rule of wizards to come up with an attack that you thought nothing could escape. Experimenting. Deciding what to do, you take action. You connect to your mental link to magic and notice another presence connected to it.

"Let's take him out together Trent!" It seemed that you would not be doing this alone and felt a surge of energy rush through you. You doubted you would break a sweat after you finished the combination you were thinking of. Finally ready, you begin.

"TERRESTRIS MECERIA!" Four earth walls sprouted up around Silver no more than a foot from him on all sides. This spell required no experimentation as you already knew it and with Thanatos's help you barely felt any drain. Not finished yet you continued. Rushing forward, you stab the scimitar strait through the stone toward where Silver would be standing. Once embedded all the way through you recite your next spell, "GLADIUS LUPATUS!" The sword shook slightly and Iron spikes Splintered through the hard earthen wall. This spell was your first experimentation and you were glad to see it went as you had hoped even though it was based off another spell you already knew, Strictura Callum. Coming upon the final piece of this elaborate attack, you finally recite the end. "OBLIDO!" The surrounding walls rushed inward with unheard of speed and struck each other with a resounding thud. You quickly stepped away, satisfied with your work.

Fenrir stood not far away from the site. He looked at you with a slight amount of interest, but not what you would expect after he had just seen you kill the man who help him with a single hand. It was then a hard fatigue crept into your being and brought you to your knees. It seemed as if creating new spells without the proper training was very taxing. You would do well to take care in the future. You looked up to your handy-work and saw only dust around the site. Waiting for it to clear, you squinted looking for the body. Instead you found a very intact and looking as if nothing happened, Silver.

The only difference was a slightly dirtied cape and the eye-patch seemed to be shorn off.

The eye that had been covered was silver in color. As well as a slanted pupil. The eye of a dragon.

"I suppose you would like an explination?" Silver says coldly.
11311121121.title: What Happens When you Threaten a Riders Dragon?

113111211211.content:
"Listen to this carefully, because I wont repeat it." You, Thanatos, Silver and Fenrir where sitting round a small fire that had been made only moments earlier.

"To begin..." Silver said. "I was born into this world 1200 years past. My mother was a human, and my father a dragon. A doomed relationship from the start but they cared for one another. My mother unfortunately, died during the birth of me and my sister, Argent. We were twins.

My sister, however, was blamed for my mothers death because of her other, more draconian features. She had human shape but dragon skin, eyes and wings which were blamed on the cause of our mothers death. Me, well I had 1 eye of a dragon so I was accepted. It also helped that I came first. Our father shunned her for our mother's death and she grew up cold and merciless. My sister left our home at 14 and I followed after her, to track her down. I knew she would only cause trouble.

After 75 years of searching I found her... She was threatening to kill a family of dragons if they did not reveal the location of our father, who had hidden himself in grief. I intervened and we fought. I defeated her and she retreated. I have heard she went to a place she called the Nether but I have heard of no such place from any other source. I became a rider after that to my dragon Slyder. Once I bonded with him, I renewed my search for my sister argent with a brand new vigor and intensity. During this time I learned that the riders on the council betrayed one another and ultimately killed each other in a brutal battle. I was the last rider of the old age.

The search lead me to our father 100 years later, After the humans fled the lands.He was mad at this point. Being in solitude for all this time with only himself for company. The moment I stepped into his den, he lashed out with a animal like fury. It was a hard battle, but in the end I killed him. During the battle my dragon, Slyder died.... Struck in the throat by my own fathers talon."

"The death of a rider's dragon usually kills the rider due to the mental strain, but the dragon in me never allowed a true bond between us and kept me alive. After probably 100 years of solitude I fell in love with one of the humans who stayed behind in secret from the dragons. Her name was... Semele. I was with her 145 long happy years until she died in my arms..." Silver paused for a second lost in memory. "She gave me the idea to begin the rider's anew, should the humans ever return to Shoven. "If the world seeks my destruction, I will destroy it."

Also there would be dragons so Thanatos would have company of his own race and you would have the help you wanted to raise him. Besides you knew it was always safer to travel in a group.

Something is wrong Trent...{/i{ Thanatos said clearly worried about something.

"What do you mean?" You said Concern on your voice

I don't think he is normal? When you tried to cut him, I felt something. Thanatos said trembling slightly.

Like he wasn't their... Dead... I don't know what Silver is, but I know he doesn't tell the truth Thanatos replied with worry and a small amount of anger in his eyes.

This just went to show he knew his stuff.

"How are you alive? It looks as if you have been decaying over a century..." You ask.

"How old are you? And don't lie this time." Thanatos demanded with a huff.

"I have lived to see 10 millenia, young dragon, and If you are wondering why. I will tell you..."

Your legs began to tremble and your breathing began to waver a bit as your body washed over with fear. Over the few seconds available to think you had come up with two choices; help the family of innocent dragons or to help your own kind. In the distance you could hear a few men scream and the bellow of a dragons roar.

'You will not succeed this night!' A distant, mysterious voice unlike your own rolled through your thoughts. Gulping, you lost control of your stomach. Relieving yourself of your meager lunch, you toppled over like a weak tree and passed out.

You awoke some time later when the screams of the soldiers eventually died out and almost instantly were slapped with regret and fear. Where was the Captain? Is everyone dead? Across from you was the burnt body of a solider that attempted to crawl his way to freedom and was quickly denied by the large beasts. All fourteen men, were either charred, broken or split open. This, to your slight relief, also included that sadistic captain. 'Serves you right you wretch.' Figuring the dragons had won the battle, you sighed with relief. Your actions at least were able to spare an innocent family during this damned war. Leaning against the rock wall of the cave, you smelled the air. Only the copper smell of blood and burnt flesh entered your nostrils and you nearly vomited again. As you neared the mouth you realized it was coming from inside of the egg, and watched transfixed as the egg shell rocked back and forth, slowly, like a metronome. Humming placidly as it did so. Then the rocking and noise stopped and it simply sat there, innocent black shell staring innocently at you. As if it's tantalizing humming and rustling had merely meant to draw you inside the cave without letting you leave.

You stared around the cave from the mouth, not quite sure if you wanted to enter in case there were any, less friendly Dragons still lurking. When you were sure that nothing lurked inside but the shiny black egg only a few yards away you skirt over the border and close the gap.

Inside the cave it was sweltering. You could feel sweat forming on your face and your breath dampening the air as you walked. The humid atmosphere bothered you slightly. The egg was now in front of you, non intrusive, just clean and black. A great shining dark enigma perched in the middle of a circle of rocks and some straw.... hang on... was the straw smoking?

On closer inspection you saw that indeed, small plumes of smoke were rolling from beneath the egg, and as you looked closer you saw the charred remains of old straw beneath it. A few embers even still remained.

'were they cooking the egg?!' you thought to yourself.

Though as you laid one hand on the egg it felt cool to the touch, smooth and glass like, and rapidly becoming colder. You felt a small shiver beneath your palm and realized the egg was vibrating slightly, convulsively. Sharp realization hit you - It needs to be kept hot!
you rushed out of the cave to the nearest tree and began to carve splinters out of it with your small knife, when you had enough you rushed back into the cave, placed them beneath the egg and called your last bit of energy you could form with your adrenaline.

"Flammo" you murmered softly. The warm crackling flames of a fire burning for hours appeared at the base, lapping happily at the egg and adding smoke, decreasing oxygen from the cave. Still you stood there watching as again, the egg began to stop vibrating and continued its placid humming.
Slowly, it rocked back and forth, back and forth, the metronome again, gradually picking up speed as it did so. You were transfixed watching the fire dance as the shadow of the egg engorged on the back wall with each movement. The fire got bigger and bigger, lapping up the sides of the black shell as it did so, hungrily working it's way to engulf the egg as it did so. You still could not move as the eggs momentum reached top speeds, and the fire thoroughly concealed it's color you watched almost helplessly as the egg burned alive.

CRACK.

The ominous noise startled you to your senses, it was hatching! You have no idea what baby dragons are like, or what havoc they can cause. You have no idea how to care for one, if they're lethal at birth, or if the mother was coming back for it. All you know is that this dragon is hatching NOW, and it's family isn't here.. It's all alone.

"Um, did you say... Momma?" You reply shakily.

"Yes, Momma" The young dragon says with a twinkle in his eye, "told me to ask first and that's what I did." The dragon takes a step forward and you take a step back. "Did I do good?" He asks. Startled, and unsure of what to say, you can only nod your head slowly, softly. The dragon laughs and you watch it flap its wings slowly up and down.

Looking closely at the wings you notice they are nearly twice that of the dragon's length. "How... I mean, can you fly?" You ask.

The dragon's playful look dies as you ask him this. "No, I'm not old enough to fly. I need to be stronger." He looks back at you again. "Mother told me that tomorrow I may be able to fly!" He says happily. You can't help but feel sorry for this poor creature knowing that if the soldiers had their way, the dragon will never see tomorrow.

'I've got to stop them.' You think to yourself. 'It's not right to harm anyone this young, no child deserves this... the dragons don't deserve this.' Your thoughts go back to your hometown and your family, then to your friend Felix who also was drafted into this hellish army. 'I hope everyone is alright.'

132.content:
“Trent! Trent where are you! Help!” The cry echoes through the forest but you have a problem of your own, the dragon pup is still nuzzling you. You back up, hoping it doesn't know what you were there for.
The cries from your captain continue. They must be being slaughtered without the defensive magic. Part of you hopes that the men knew what they had been ordered to do. It would alleviate some of the guilt for leaving them behind. But as the screams continue to echo out of that cave, the bottom of your stomach seemed to have vanished. “What have I done” you think.

The dragon is still following you as you edge away. You decide to reach forward and as your hand touches it's muzzle you think “Mummy” A moment later you realize that it wasn't you who thought that. “Mummy, hungry” the thought floats to the fore of your head seemingly of it's own volition. “Mumm-” The thought stops when you jerk your hand away from the dragon. Some of the orange goo that covered the dragon comes away with your hand and you realize that it must be yolk like from a chickens egg. Except there was enough to cover this dragon the size of a small cat. The dragon moved forward again, it's sleek head curling around your hand to lick at the yolk. Despite yourself you giggle as the small tongue trails up and down your hand, “Food, good, thank mummy” This time you do not pull away, the young dragons simplistic thoughts are distracting you from your own guilt at leaving the soldiers. After it has licked your hand clean you sit down, stroking it as it's thought wash over you, providing release from your own haunting ones. As you stroke it you see that besides orange, the dragon is also...

1323.content:
You can see the ground on the other side of the dragon. The dragon shifts and for a second you can see quite distinctly that the picture of the ground through the dragon and the ground around it do not match before the dragons skin seems to shift before settling so that it matches the ground once again. Looking closer you see that the effect is not perfect, the image shifts slightly as the dragon in and exhales and it looks as if it were fragmented as though viewed through hundreds of tiny shards of glass all stuck together to make a looking glass. You presume that this is the scales. All that is easily visible is the eyes, ice blue, and the red open mouth as the dragon yawns.

The dragons thoughts are soothing and as you see it settle it's head on your arm you feel sleepy yourself, even though you had slept until only an hour before the attack. Shifting the dragon slightly you remove your shirt and use it to form a sling in which you settle the baby dragon while you walk.

Even as you walk the dragons dreams flash before your eyes, the memories of it's first two hours of life the only things it has to dream about. You walk as far as you can before the urge to sleep begins to push at you from your own mind as well as the dragons. As safe as you can be at the moment you settle onto a relatively soft patch of earth and lay down your head. Sleep washes over you and your dreams are of your life and some few of having four legs and fleeing the creatures who wore the night and stepped like thunder on the shells of your fellows eggs. You remember seeing someone who, wore the night best, as if he were part of it, he ran into the forest and you followed.

13233.content:
You leave your eyes closed when you wake, you can feel the dragon on your arms. Still asleep. You leave your head on the ground and try to sleep again. You feel as if you had run for miles despite the fact that you have obviously slept for hours.

"Bloody dragons, taunting us by throwing the dead into the village." Said a gruff voice nearby. Your eyes fly open and you see two men, one bulky and carrying a hunting spear while the other was taller, thin but with obvious strength, like the longbow at his back. You can't run without being seen and surely being seen is not a good idea when you are holding a dragon. You stay as still as possible hoping that they will miss you. They have entered the clearing now.

"Still," said the tall man with the longbow, "It works in our favour, we know they missed one. He's probably out in the forest. I only saw the party once but I'd swear that I didn't see the young mage in that pile and it would explain how we lost. That mage was supposed to be almost a guarantee of victory."

"Probably deserted, 'e looked like a cowardly runt if you ask me." Said the bulky man with the spear, it had been he who spoke first as well.

"That is not for you to speculate Clide. Deserter or not he is powerful and if we intent to destroy that dragons nest we are going to need power. Now stop complaining and keep an eye out or I will see to it personally you get the night watch for the next three nights. Anyway Do you want the dragons to find him first. They showed respect to our dead. But if they know one survived they'de be hunting him sure as I beat you at stones each night."

They had almost reached the other end of the clearing now, your almost safe. Then the dragon makes a small snuffling noise from your arms. The taller mans head whips around, the other mans is slower but they are both staring at you. You feel panic rising. Then you realise, they are not staring at you. They are staring through you. Their eyes seem to be focused on a point behind you, as if they could see through you to the other side. The bulky one shrugs and mutters some under the breath profanity about ghosts in the woods. The other admonishes him as a superstisious fool and orders him onward to continue the search. Soon the two have disapeared into the trees.

"They knew it was a nest!" you exclaim the moment you are sure they are out of earshot "They knew it was a nest and they attacked anyway!" You know you are shouting at nothing, even risking discovery but the outrage builds in you and you act before realizing it, raising your hand you shout "Incendia Tempestas." Your anger burns, it fuels the fire that springs around you, you are breathing heavily, the fire swirls around you and the baby dragon shifting from red to blue in a magnificent pattern.

After a minute your anger feels burned away and you realize with a shock the spell you were channeling, Incendia Tempestas takes three fully trained fire mages to produce a result. Even then at least two more defensive mages are needed to guarantee that control is kept of the blaze and bring it to its full power to continually blaze for as long as required. Without the defensive mages, the fire would just disapear after the intended result. Without the fire mages, the blaze would continue to scorch everything unless the defensive mages could keep control of the blaze, and you were no fire mage...

1323312.content:
Not only are you no fire mage but you certainly could not have summoned a blaze of that strength, let alone control it. Suddenly you think of the baby dragon. What if you hurt it? The irony in that would sting, but luckily the dragon looked unharmed and had in fact woken up. It turns to face you and at the moment it's eyes meet yours you feel a brush at the back of your mind. No more than a feather against your consciousness and the effect was gone. Yet, you could still tell that there was something still sitting there.

One thing rose to the top of your mind. "lux lucis of incendia." Tapping into your power you nearly stated the words to try and figure out what they might do. Knowing better, you quickly stop as you had no idea what would happen. Your instructors in the militia made this painfully clear once a few other new comers decided to try anyway. The poor saps engulfed themselves and their tent in a tornado of fire.

What is the worst thing that could happen though? 'Light of fire' Doesn't sound all to dangerous.

13233121.content:
Wary of any unknown spell but curious as the dead cat you decide to try it out but you take precautions. You tap the power and say “Obex ut vox” weaving a warding around yourself that would prevent anything born of your power passing beyond it. This way should something go wrong you could at least be sure of not starting a forest fire, something you didn't think of in your earlier rage. The thought burns your cheeks, you were never prone to angry outbursts, not to mention never used magic in one of the few and certainly never woven fire for it.

Weaving shields against magic was usually effective against yourself, but situations where that is useful are rare. For that matter shielding is rarely useful, against another you need nearly four times the power to block an action of theirs. Much better to block the result than the power.

None the less it had it's function here. Then touching the power you incant “lux lucis of incendia” As you speak you catch sight of the baby dragon, a shifting of colors slightly askew of those behind it. It's eyes catch yours and then they vanish as you complete the incantation, you step back in surprise and your own hand at the edge of your vision vanishes as well. Bringing it in front of your eyes does nothing to reestablish it's existence. If you couldn't feel it you would have been sure it was gone, your legs and torso as well, you can only assume about the head. That feather on your consciousness is back, like another mind just touching. You are sure this time that it is the dragon, you feel as if you could point to it, even though it was now completely invisible. You think of the firestorm again, still wondering how you controlled it and to your shock suddenly you burst into flames, the dragon too, it's skin glowing like hot iron as flames leapt as much as a meter above the dragon.

Surprisingly the dragon seemed unfazed, and equally surprising you could not feel anything either. The flames were touching the trees surrounding you but the trees did not catch, then you notice, the flames do not curl around the branch, they pass right through it. Then they vanish and you are standing there with the dragon pup, no longer the orange of the night before, nor the red hot iron color but a deep crimson with a few patches of polished brass or copper. “Expello vox” The shield and lux lucis of incendia stop pulling from your power and you finally release it. The dragon instantly vanishes again, only visible by the slight distortion as it's chest expands and contracts as it breathes and the eyes that seem to look out of nowhere. That brush against the mind came again. “Fire's Light, Hide, Safe.” and again the sense of being able to point to the dragon without looking. Hide, Safe. Of course! The spell is of illusions, but that was fire magic you drew on, not illusion. Light not the mind. Maybe it would even fool illusionists, who could sense normal illusions and even see right through them if they were strong. Then another thing hit you, you've been channeling all morning, if there were any other mages present within a mile they would know what had passed. Running and still somehow knowing that the dragon was following close behind like a lizard streaking across the ground, and completely ignorant of the direction you are taking you just know that you must get away, you touch the power and call out “Velieris nos, Velieris vox,” You feel the shields around you and the dragon form, and almost trip for not seeing your feet, the power felt distant now, as it always is when you shield it from others. You keep running, night sets in, the second night in a row you have run, the second night in a row you feared to be set upon by humans as much or more than the noble dragons.

You run through the next morning as well, and as you do you begin to recover your senses you feel a thread of the power fueling your muscles and almost trip again for the shock, you had heard some things could be done with the power without incantations, most concerning your own body and all taking the direst of desperation or the greatest of wills to achieve. It was like the illusions, but they were only partially guided by the mind and they had shifted erratically. Even knowing this you keep running.

Compendium of Spells in this chapter:

lux lucis of incendia - Light of the fire - An ambiguous spell that allows the user to bend light through the fire element. The illusion itself is controlled by the mind of the caster and can easily shift from one thing to another for example thinking of hiding brings invisibility and the thought of the firestorm created illusionary flames. These illusions are relatively easy to break, even a hand passing through them will cause the illusion to vanish altogether (Though the fool who sticks his hand in the fire, illusionary or otherwise probably deserves a burnt hand to prevent a repeat performance)

Obex ut vox - Shield the power - This spell shields the power, think circuit breaker, if a spell cast by the user draws to much power he or she will be instantly cut off for an instant (the shield loses power too therefore power is regained but all active spells are cut off). Shields can also be used to block other mages but almost four times the power being blocked is required to maintain the shield, therefore it can only be used if the power difference between you and your opponent is extremely significant, even then both of you are now wide open to other mages or even simple soldiers. It is regarded as far better to simply fight the result, e.g. put out the fire or ground the lightning.

Expello Vox - Dispell the power - Regarded as the proper way to end your spells, simply dropping the power off the spell sometimes has explosive results as the tail end of the power has no stopper. This spell actually forces the power to the void, unlike a shield which cuts the user off from the power, though the buffering effects are similar.

Velieris nos - Hide us - A less ambiguous invisibility spell, the target us is defined by the mind at the initiation of the spell and is more stable than the first spell. This is another spell unconsciously gleaned through a link to the dragon. Desperation drove this spell which would normally need incredible concentration to maintain a wide enough spell focus to touch both Trent and his draconic partner.

Velieris Vox - Hide the power - Does what it says, prevents another mage from feeling the power used by the caster or the inherent talent in the caster.

The title "Vox of incendia lux lucis" means; The power of Fire's Light
13233121.title: Vox of incendia lux lucis

132331212.content:
Most people would feel shame fleeing unknown foes two nights in a row but you've always remembered what you were taught by the defensive mages. "A skilled defensive mage can take any hit with impunity, a master knows not to be there when the hit lands" and so you ran seeking shelter in any form. Something in which to collect, think things through and plan. Another brush against the conciousness, an ostrich feather to a sparrows of the ones before. “Two-leg seen-ones, They will see-smell-hear us, Defendo officio odoratus et sonor” This time you did trip. To your mind the pictures the dragon sent seemed to fit those words and that last was just a strong feeling of lack of smells or sounds, but those words seem to fit it so well somehow. Already touching the power you say the words, you can't tell if anything has changed but you try to make a whistling sound and nothing comes out, you speak and nothing again. You pick yourself up off the ground and take off in another direction. Branches snap and leaves shift as you run but no sound seems to come from anything caused by you and the dragon. The dragons presence is almost palpable now, you know exactly where it is behind you, sometimes beside, but never ahead. Every now and then another image passes through your consciousness. “No two-leg seen-ones.” “Sky-fire low, sore legs soon rest.” “Rock-roof ahead” The last was a cave, the picture from the dragon showed you exactly how to get there. The route was fairly circuitous it seemed unlikely anything would be in the cave. Briefly you wonder how the dragon could have known that, it certainly wasn't in anybodies line of sight until they are right on top of it. “Curvo inlustris visus” Another spell, how did the dragon know these. The dragons spells had all been pretty harmless, you shield, “Obex ut vox” and speak the words.

You are almost blinded. Everything around you is now visible, on all sides. Everything for almost a mile by your estimation, it's hard to tell really. You reduce the flow of power to the spell and the radius reduces, a bit easier to process. Amazing, it's better than one of those lenses that some commanders use. It's disorienting but you can see the cave now, every facet of it's entrance inside and out, at least until there is no more light to see. You cut power to the spell with a quick “Terminus,” you doubt you could walk and maintain that particular spell simultaneously. You proceed to the cave at a slower place, there was no immediate danger within a mile, and take notice of the forest. Still within dragon held lands there was no signs of human habitation, a truly beautiful and tranquil place, your spells mean that some of the shyer wildlife come a great deal closer to you than ever before. Reaching the cave a sense of relief washes over you. You drop the shields with another “Terminus” leaving only the warding against the detection of the power. Instead you turn to the mouth of the cave and turn your mind to the creation of appropriate defensive wardings.

“Contego porta quod nos ex foris.”

As an afterthought you say “Incendia vacuus fomitis” Having to then reduce the power tenfold as the fire flared up far beyond what it should with the amount of power supplied. The dragon curled up by the fire, invisible though it was you were sure of it, just not sure of why you knew.

Your stomach makes it's presence known and you realize that you have not eaten for a whole day. You leave the cave, the dragon does not follow you this time, and head a short way into the forest. There you snare several rabbits with the most humane methods you can think of and return to the cave. You drop two of the rabbits in front of the dragon, and put the rest into the fire with a crude kabob. A good meal later your lie down on the hard rock and release all hold on the power but for the wards and a smaller version of the fire. No longer fueling your limbs with the power they hang limp and you fall almost immediately to sleep.

Rousing In the morning without incident, you make plans. No matter what you do you want to learn more about this dragon and this bond.

New Spell Information:

Defendo officio odoratus et sonor - ward against smell and sound - neutralizes any sound or smell produced by the spells target, by nature an air spell but not particularly difficult for anybody to wield. Another spell instinctively used by illusionist dragons.

Curvo inlustris visus - Bend light to my sight - In the same way illusions bend light around the target this spell redirects light towards the eyes of the caster allowing them to see as if from the point from which the light was bent. This spell can be refined to target light at a specific location with practice instead of redirecting all light within range of the caster.

Terminus - End - Can be used to cut off ongoing spells, many variations of this spell exist and some are typically favoured in different institutions but some people just use what comes to mind at the time.

Contego porta quod nos ex foris. - Shield the entrance from us and outsiders. - A constructed defensive warding designed to block anything of the casters from leaving, and any outsiders from entering. If the spell fails, the drain of energy it will cause the caster to awaken.

incendia vacuus fomitis - Fire without fuel - A spell which creates a flame of variable size (Variable is based on the power supplied and the strength in the fire element) Does not consume air, wood or oil in it's burning and is useful in situations where little air is present such as in a cave. it is also useful in combat with wielders of air who would seek to remove fires fuel from the field in an attempt to extinguish the flame.

1323312121.content:
The very next day you made the decision to proceed into the dragon lands, for all you knew they might hold information on bonds between humans and dragons, certainly humans didn't seem to and if they did it was buried so far that your bound to be caught before you get it. For all you knew warrants for your arrest and your description were being distributed to any and all settlements. The dragons certainly seemed the safer option for the moment. That was two weeks ago anyway, and now your wondering why you chose a slog through Jumpin wood instead of civilization.

Those weeks had been constant walking, hunting, and sleeping. The black suit from the raid long worn and tattered, the hunting had seen to that. Your hunting has also improved, the illusions really help hunting prey, if they cannot see, smell or hear you they aren't likely to run away unless they happen to bump into you. You suppose it's a bit unfair for the animals. You don't even give them a chance to feel fear. The weeks have also given you a chance to think. You think there is a link between the eclipse's color and the increase in fire magic. You woke up that first morning to find the dragon sleeping unscathed, in the fire you had created the night before.

The little dragon was the main reason for the problems you encounter on this journey. His mind is now in constant contact with yours and over the weeks of this growing connection he has become more fluent, originally the messages were still pictures, then the same overlaid with a word and now he just sounds like a child of their fifth year of life. Anything he said about himself was accompanied by a picture of the sun moving across the sky to the moon moving the opposite way until they crossed and the moon blotted out the sun except for a ring of fire burning brightly where the moon couldn't cover the whole sun. The image seemed to translate to Eclipse of the burning shadow and you just started calling him Eclipse. He had a name for you as well, two-leg shadow walker. You think you'll persist with Trent though.

Throughout all this, you continued to practice your magic. Every night you spend one hour reviewing defensive magic, fortifying the camp site, preparing trap/wards using spells such as “voco terra parietis” and “Triggered terra vorago” a wall of earth and a trap which will become a hole in the ground the moment someone steps on it, respectively. Traps were good because it took only a small flow of the power to maintain them until the trap is triggered, a better gamble than to put a hole in the ground and cover it up every night. Another hour was spent practicing elemental magics, sometimes it is necessary to know that what you have wrought will not continue to exist. A third hour went into practicing the illusion spells that passed through the link, you've already managed to control the illusions more precisely and even some others that don't shift when your mind chooses something else to look at. The spell that extends sight also has been tamed so that you can choose to see from only one point as if you were standing there. Most of the illusions drew from fire but some drew from air, lightning and water as well. Many in fact were combinations of two elements working in concert. Fire to weave light and air to produce sensation were prevalent amongst the more complex spells that came across the bond. One spell that you haven't tried yet for fear of discovery is “divum lux lucis” which by careful analysis of the flow of magic it drew seemed to involve throwing a mass of light into the air and having it shatter into tiny multicolored fragments. What use this might have evades you for the moment but you suppose it could be used in signaling, except that anybody in a hundred miles would be able to see it.

Today is a morning like any other and the first thing you do is mutter “Sinus lux lucis ut meus os” Wincing in the moment of disorientation as your sight shifts to a point several hundred feet above the ground, definitely somewhere your sight shouldn't be naturally. You look down and a sense of cold dread. There is a black mass moving through the forest and others moving towards it. It takes a moment to realize that the first is a unit similar to the one you were assigned to and the others are shadows. There is no hope to run. That many dragons and that large an army, the battle will spread miles. Both sides wouldn't hesitate to take you down, least ways you think they wouldn't to the dragons your another human in a black suit and to the humans your a deserter and possibly they might even know by now you are traveling with Eclipse. Eclipse's eyes are beside yours, somehow you already know he doesn't channel magic but somehow he still twists light, You feel his mind next to yours as well. “Prepare friend for today we lead the dance of light.” A flood of possible illusion and defensive spells wash into you from the dragon. Since when did Eclipse have defensive spells to give, most of them still linked to the creation of light, but they would be almost impossible to dispel outright because they were no longer sustained by power. Returning your sight to your body you stand next to Eclipse and say “permissum nos exsisto turpis quod incuratus, quod voco leviter vesica” You feel a weight in your invisible hand and you grip it tightly, you feel a thread of the power moving to it, to maintain it's lightlessness and another to you and another to Eclipse. Another still moves in your arms and your legs strengthening them so that you can run or fight faster and longer.

Spell descriptions

voco terra parietis - summon earth wall - Defensive magic, manipulates target earth into a wall-like structure.

Triggered terra vorago - Triggered earth hole - prepares to create a hole in the ground when the trigger is met, Defensive warding magic, useful in that it only draws significant energy when triggered which saves repeated use when the hole will not necessarily be needed

divum lux lucis - Sky Lights - Essensially magical fireworks, can be used as a flare to alert forces miles away or amuse children to great effect.

permissum nos exsisto turpis quod incuratus, quod voco leviter vesica - let us be unseen and unheard, and summon the lightless blade - Three spell inclusive construct, nulifies any light or sound produced or reflected by the caster and summons an invisible sword through defensive magic.

Title - ut vicis goes per - As time goes by.
1323312121.title: ut vicis goes per

13233121211.content:
Opening your eyes to the sky you watch as both forces close in, humans from the east and dragons from the west. The humans are now within half a mile and you drop the spell. In your fortifications you wait until you hear some of the men approaching, talking as they marched even with the imminent danger of a skirmish with dragons. “All this for a deserter, even a mage. Why are we doing this?”

A second voice replies “It's orders, anyway would you want your companies mage to go running off to leave a whole squad to die? It's got to be a lesson same as any deserter is hanged. The trackers say he was with a dragon, albeit a small one. He's a traitor too.” One of the men pointed to your hiding place. “There, the trackers say that was the last place the trail leads to, can't say I see where he might be, the whole place is out in the open even if it is fortified.”

The men spread out trying to encircle your outcropping of rock, one steps on your pitfall trap and the ring of earth around the fortification collapses, throwing more than twenty men into the pit which then collapsed in on itself leaving rough ground and crushing the men. You wince at that thought but it had to be done, especially after what they just said. You bring up the sword as a cry of “undermine calx , teres calx” from at least three different sources collapses your walls and then flattens the rubble to a clear road. Leaving you standing atop the hill, you feel Eclipse beside you straighten and somehow you know he is readying a flame, his teeth are bared and the red inside of his mouth just visible. The men falter however, you hear them asking where you are, “How can he have escaped?” “He must be here somewhere.” “Dispel.” “Dispel” You feel the power push against your illusions but they remain inviolate. “How, such power.” Keeping your voice low you draw fire and say “Speculum” and a number of reverse Trent's appear randomly on the hill wielding flaming swords. They charge the men. The mages continue shouting “Dispel” until one has the idea to try attacking directly, “Incendium Flagellum” The cry is repeated by the other mages of whom five have now arrived. The fire whips cut through the charging illusions and they dissipated but others appeared to take their place, the swordsmen were even less effective, engaged in duels against foes who are infinitely flexible and fast, but who would do no returned harm. With a word “incendium” the flames of the swords became real and suddenly each man who dueled an illusion was falling down screaming at the burns while the illusions moved on to a new target, becoming dancing nightmares. “” The whips of fire held by the mages became water and again the whips sliced through the men and dissipating the swords. Still in the half minute it had taken the mages to react to tactics they had never seen before a good fifty soldiers had been downed and several more were barely walking. Eclipse let loose a firestorm that engulfed nearly the whole attacking force however you could see through it, men fled with terror at the illusionary flames and only a few were caught in the actual flame. Eclipse beat his wings and leapt off the ground. His first flight, how timely you thought. Still invisible three dragons of different colors appeared around him, all apparently dodging the mages whips of fire, water and even one of thunder. Meanwhile you put a hand to the ground and say “Bake terra” Cracks run through the ground and steam rises while the men leap from foot to foot trying to get off the burning earth. They try to charge you again and this time the illusions who face them are not simple humans but flaming demons with horns and poleaxes, the flames and the axes were real and that was enough. More than a few of the men broke and fled at the sight of them, over the scorched earth and at the expense of the soles of their feet. The rest perished as the demons charged them, setting alight any they touched and any who evaded them met the sharp blade of the summoned poleaxes. The mages still to preoccupied with the illusionary dragons under the command of Eclipse to save the men.

The final stroke was the spell “divum lux lucis” The ball of light in the form of a fireball seemed to explode from the top of the hill and shoot high into the air before shattering and falling in a rain of fire. The soldiers routed and were off the field before the first flame fell, the mages routed too, overwhelmed by being unable to tell the illusions from the realities, still wielding their whips they fled with a total lack of decorum, trying to keep an eye on the illusionary dragons of eclipse as well as the now nearer real dragons. The dragons are in fact doing something quite unusual, they are waiting. The humans now retreating there was no honour in attacking. A second later you realize that was not your thought but Eclipses. You too are content to let the humans flee, interesting that you think of them as humans now not people. Certainly they are still people but it is almost as if your no longer one of them.
You settle down as the last of the illusionary flames settle into the ground. Hopefully the dragons will turn back now, given that the fight is no longer going to happen. You don't think you can fight dragons too, somehow your power with fire has significantly increased and illusions don't take all that much power but so much fire and so many illusions, easy enough to overwhelm five reasonably weak mages, which was probably why there were five, none of them were trained defensively. But it was not power enough for anything to spare. You tuck the invisible sword into a sheath taken from one of the perished soldiers and tie it to your belt. To your relief the dragons turn away and begin flying east. Relief until you notice four of them remaining anyway, low flying they came to a landing off over the scorched earth of the hill. Two dull grey like iron, and one as burnished silver with one scarlet dragon circling overhead.

The Silver dragon spoke. As it did you notice it's tongue is the same color as it's scales. “You have been accused of the abduction of a child and the possible murder of the same child. You will submit to the court of twelve dragons. Come.” Whatever force decided this dragons tongue should be silver had an immense sense of humor. “Step forward and be taken.”
