13233121211.title: The Illusionist's battle

choices: Remain a captive of the dragons hospitality
Break oath and try to escape
132331212112.content:
“I submit.” You say, surely Eclipse is enough evidence. He followed you, not that his company isn't welcome. Not to mention he was most definitely alive, hovering overhead and slightly behind you. Then you realize that the other dragons might not know he was there. In face, almost certainly not or they wouldn't have accused you of murder at least. You touched that overlap between your thoughts and thought to Eclipse, “Can you drop the illusion?” “How?” comes a reply. “How do you normally do it?” “By needing to do it, I want to but unless it's my life it's not a need. Sorry. You can do it though, if you can get a spell out.”

You touch the power and Whisper “Rectus Lux Lucis” Two things happen simultaneously the first is what you expected, Eclipse appears, Shining polished copper scales surrounding darker bronze as they had been for the last week when they had stopped changing. The other probably should have been expected, the silver dragon roared “He's incanting!” and leaped onto you pinning you to the ground with a claw. The iron dragons moved to either side of the silver and the reds swooped before one of them saw Eclipse and told the others. You try to say “See he's alive,” try because the silver dragons claw is still weighing heavily on your chest. The silver dragon's claw eases up a bit, Just a bit though, enough to say “I really do submit, I've done nothing wrong.” Low growls emit from all of the dragons and the silver dragon tightens it's claws again. You feel a flash of fear as the dragons wings beat hard and lift it off the ground, leaving you hanging in it's claws nothing but the sight of it's belly, wings and the occasional flash of sky. And of course the ever present sense of Eclipse back at the camp. Through his ears you hear the female red dragon saying. “Come with us child. You shall be cared for. You must learn child not to run away.” The red dragons take off and then the grey ones. Eclipse follows after but he says to you “I'm following for you not for them. I'm not a child!” The distance increasing you cut the spell to keep Eclipse visible. A sense of amusement comes through the link as the dragons immediately start to look around for him. You chuckle too but it is hard to be amused when the wind feels like it is going to tear your hair out and the silver dragons claws definitely needed to loosen up a bit. Your going to be very bruised at the end of this journey. That is if you manage to avoid any broken bones. The journey only takes a few hours. You don't know where you are or how far you've traveled and Eclipse doesn't yet have much practice in figuring out how far or in what direction. All he could tell you is “it's hard to keep up, we're going fast.” So when you descended all you knew is that you had gone west.

A few feet from the ground the silver dragon drops you and the iron dragons swoop into take a positions beside you. Aching you raise yourself to your feet, taking three tries to do so. The silver dragon lands and directs you to a cave entrance and down a semi-lit passageway with several pathways off to the side. The silver dragon points you to one of them and says “You are a guest here unless you are deemed guilty, you will be provided with food and water, but remember that while you are a guest you may not leave until you have faced the court of twelve dragons.” the words seemed formal, like a watchman reading the rights to a man about to be arrested. The next had less of a ritual tone but were still formal. “You are human and a mage. You are permitted to practice magic, or perform any other action you desire so long as that action does not negatively affect any dragon nor in any way cause you to be at or to affect a location outside of the bounds of this cave. You will be watched and sent for when the court is ready to sit. Remember, there is a war on and time may not be found for a criminal against an army for a long time.” The ritual tone came back. “I leave you now and give you time to contemplate your role in this crime. Prepare your words wisely.” The silver dragon left, followed by one of the iron ones, the other settled down to watch and the reds were nowhere to be found but you would have bet a ton to a pound that they were still with Eclipse. Who was somewhere further away from you than he had ever been in his life. Though your quite sure he is still in the complex somewhere, worrying but in pleasant surroundings by the impression of the bond. He still doesn't talk all that much and probably has his own problems to worry about just at the moment so his lack of communication is acceptable. You look around, there wasn't much to the cave, it was large enough for a young dragon, about fifteen feet by fifteen feet, though hardly square, and the roof about twenty feet high. A few small stalactites and stalagmites but none more than a foot long. The majority of the floor was covered in hay and that about counts for everything. At least your not running anymore you think and settle down to wait. Implementing defensive magic to create bedding using a complicated little spell that created a bubble of water and increased the surface tensile strength with the essence of the nearby earth so that it formed a pillow and a sort of thin mattress. Then you go for a look around the caves using “Sinus lux lucis ut meus os.” You can only figure out so much by sight, sound is to difficult to carry with air over such distance and around corners, light only works because it is not physical and is a manipulation of pure energy. None the less you are pretty sure that this place is a nursery much larger than the nest you were going to attack earlier. You cut the spell when you hear someone approaching. The silver dragon returned with a small red dragon maybe halfway through it's first year growth spurt. The silver dragon spoke again in a ritual tone. “You have remained our guest this hour, you have shown that you may be trusted and so I must ask your word of honour not to try to escape. Do you give your word of honour?” You thought of Eclipse and even if you did escape, could he, from what you were getting through the bond he seemed almost as restricted as you were, even if for different reasons, whatever they might be. “I give my word of honour and seal myself to lux lucis quod estus of flamma.” Where had that last bit come from. The silver dragon seemed a little taken aback too, only a little. “Then your word is taken and the guard shall be relieved, a child instead will watch for chance that another might seek to break your word in your stead.” The ritual ended he said “You know of the flame oath, how?” “I don't, is that what it is called, what is it, I just said it.” you reply. The silver dragon almost seemed to smile. “It is the most binding oath of a fire dragon. I may visit you, you know of dragons and steal a child but you do not seem to be cruel like most of those we face, and in fact you are barely on the cusp of those we leave, though you didn't it seems so perhaps this is a repayance of sorts.” Okay that was odd, he seems to be convinced of your guilt but interested too. For that matter he is interesting to you as well, Eclipse doesn't know much of what dragons do. He was only born the day he met you. Perhaps you could learn why the dragons started this war and why they leave villages and any other non-combatants alone. Certainly it seems as if the silver tongue may have been a part of his character, not a twisted sense of humor.

The, relatively, small dragon settled himself, your not sure how you could tell but your sure of it, down to watch, obviously expecting to have a long boring watch of the human. Well maybe it was but you still wanted to practice illusion. Drawing power and saying “lux lucis of flamma” you create three different colored balls of light and try to juggle them, all the while making sure that each stayed the same color as it had started. Gradually you increased the speed and number of balls until you had seven balls of light, each one color of the rainbow, no longer being juggled but spinning around in a complex pattern of light similar to that some illusionists entertained crowds with at the fair. The difference is that these are real light while the others are pictured in the persons mind, depending on the skill of the illusionist there may even be variation between what one person saw to the next even if it was similar. This way everyone saw the same thing. The young dragon was staring, obviously no longer bored. You laugh and create some more complex light shows before switching to changing the environment, forcing you to use a more complex spell, it is impossible to imagine a whole environment in much detail and maintain it in that detail for the duration of the spell. “vultus lux lucis ut meus mos” will do. You create a lush forest grove and then a desert oasis then the back alley of a city street. Then you were standing in open sky with no ground visible. Even your own imagination it probably would have made you flinch if you had not been using Sinus lux lucis ut meus os every morning. The only thing you did not do was become invisible. You thought it would be safer that way. The young dragon was practically leaping from toe to toe now, obviously it had been told not to speak to you, it seemed to be bursting to now. You say hello to it and say “any requests” You almost burst out laughing as it obviously struggles between the desire to do as it was instructed and the desire to make a request. For several hours you practice before another young dragon arrives with a carcass and a skin of water. It lays both at the entrance and says to the the other dragon “I've got the next watch of the human, matron says you should hurry to the dinner hall before the others eat the whole lot by themselves. The hunters brought in lots of deer today, even the human gets a whole one.” The other dragon says “Thanks I'm starved” and runs off up the hall. You pull the venison over on magical solid and summon a fire beneath it, leaving it to cook rotating slowly you tie the spell off so that you don't need to think about it.
Then you lie down on the bedding you made earlier. Even though the bubble doesn't break it still feels weird with a bed made out of water, it sloshed when you rolled over.

After the meat was cooked you ate some and left the rest encased in magical solid to preserve it until tomorrow. Shortly after several young dragons including that first red show up and say to the watching dragon that they had come to help relieve a bit of the boredom. They all clustered around the cave entrance looking nothing so much as a group of children trying to spy on something they were not supposed to see through a small window. A thing you yourself had been caught at and punished for a number of times as a child. Chuckling to yourself you heard one of them say “You lied Reodrad, he's boring.” another said “Shush Theran, I think he's asleep. Anyway if he was doing what Reodrad said he probably couldn't do it all day long.” This voice was definitely female and reminded Trent again of a little girl telling the little boys off thinking she was three years older. Trent had had one of those back home too, later he had quite liked that girl as he remembered. “If it's anything like your breathing fire he probably cant do it for more than thirty seconds at once Theran.” That brought a bunch of giggling, an odd sound to hear from dragons even if they were children. You quietly say the words first to alter your point of vision so that to you it seemed like you were standing in front of them, even though that was only what your eyes were telling you, your back was still comfortably on the water bed. Then you drew light of the flame again. Creating an orb of light that floated white in front of the dragons. Several pulled back then leaned forward eagerly, you hadn't done anything that they could see so it must have come as a shock to see something. You make the ball split into seven different orbs of the colors of the rainbow again, you make them spin in a complex spherical pattern until you throw them all back into the middle where they collided in an explosion of multicolored sparks. You figure that entertaining these child dragons is as good a way to practice illusion as anything. It would be nice if they would talk to you though, if that silver dragon comes back maybe you'll ask about that and about seeing Eclipse again of course.
132331212112.title: Flamma sacramentum

1323312121121.content:
It was an exhilarating feeling, flying. Free even from predators, though for a dragon not many of them existed for dragons. Except humans. But their numbers made up for that lack. The only one you can trust is Trent. Only Trent. You felt him in the back of your mind, pain passed through the bond. Too much pain. That silver needs to let go a bit. Why couldn't he ride on you anyway. You had thought to offer but thought better of it seeing the red female and thinking of the attitude Trent could remember Dragons showing humans. You doubt that to allow one on your back would be regarded as sane by that dragon. She already thought you were a child, no need to add nuts to the mix. Mixed nuts, rumbling laughter came from your throat. Trent had had some in the pack he carried, there weren't many but they had tasted good. Another rumble of laughter at the thought change.

Though the link you felt the power Trent draws from waning and knew that soon he would vanish into the shadows. The silver dragon was getting too far away, the spell takes more effort when affecting something further away. It was an alarming drain of power. You think at Trent “I'm following you not them.” You keep flying, working hard to keep up with the bigger dragons. Trent finally cuts the spell. You laugh again as the red female twists to find you, looking everywhere. You call out “I'm here.” The red dragon looks at you annoyed, you wonder if she should be paying more attention to where she is flying, “Reveal yourself this instant!” You look at her, “I can't, Trent revealed me and he's too far away now.” She growls but turns back to her path. Still having some trouble keeping up you tell Trent so because you want to communicate but just after that he becomes rater distracted and the pain reaches a peak. You figure he is probably landing. By the comparative speed you would say maybe another hour of flying before you land. The hour passed, slowly. As you landed you felt relief, your wings had been stretched out far to long. You fold them at your sides with satisfaction and follow the beckoning red.

She leads you through a series of caves, the main passageway over a hundred feet tall and some of the side passages were the same. She led you to an enormous cave filled with young dragons, most were red of one shade or another. Four were green, three blue, three yellow and one black. The black was the smallest of all of them, probably no older than yourself. “Go and meet your kin, little one. And try not to get stepped on, remember we can't see you.” The red female turned to leave and one of the red dragons piped up, “Argam came through earlier, he took Reodrad with him to watch one of the caves Matron and he ordered Reasa to watch the moment she is finished with her meal. Matron what are they watching?” The matron, your guessing that it is the red female, replied with “never you mind Theran. Show this child a bed, then introduce him to the others. He is not to leave the youngling's coup” Theran looked around and you open your mouth so that he can see something. He backs away and you realize that seeing something was in fact seeing the inside of a mouth suspended in midair. You closed it again and said “Hi,” it's what Trent always said to new people in his memories. Theran just stares, though what he's staring at your not sure, as he can't see you. “He's an illusionist, you've studied them in your lessons now stop gawking and do as I have said.” The matron obviously thought that saying jump meant jump now. Theran said “Follow me” and scurried off into the crowd of young dragons. You followed and were led to a series of caves which were small enough that only first year dragons could possibly fit. Theran directed you to one of these and said “Here's yours.” You remember where it is then you set off with Theran. He leads you back to the hall and calls out over the din. “Everybody. We have a new dragon with us.” The other dragons are looking at him funny, at least you think they are, you haven't had much experience with reading expressions. “Where.” One of them calls out. “Here, he's an illusionist.” The other dragons are starting to turn away, obviously thinking he's stringing them on. Theran looks at you and hisses, “Open you mouth, that'll show them.” You open you mouth and the whispers start amongst the children. Then at the right moment. So much so that you almost doubt that it was a coincidence you feel the light around you shift and you are visible. A touch from your link tells you that the timing was coincidence but he will help you stay like that. You know that he is practicing magic again but don't know what. The words he thinks mean nothing to you.

Theran moves away to talk to others. You move through the crowd but none of the others seem to want to talk to you. In the end you find another who seems to be alone. The small black dragon. Up close you notice that it's wing on the left side is deformed. It probably will never fly. After your own first attempt your not sure if this is a blessing or a curse but somehow you know that it is the latter. You have a choice to fly or not at least. None the less your own wings still ache. “Hi,” you say to it. “Hi,” it replies, “What is an illusionist dragon? I haven't started my lessons yet I don't know anything.” You reply “I don't know myself. I'm only two weeks old and this is the first thing I've said to a dragon. I think it might have something to do with the fact that normally no-one sees me. Trent's always going on about illusions and that's when he goes invisible too so I think thats right.” The other dragon looked at you and said “I thought you said you hadn't talked to a dragon before.” “Trent's not a dragon. He's a human, the only one I can trust. He saved me from the other humans.”

Before you knew it the black dragon has leapt onto you crying out and trying to claw you, screaming “HUMAN'S KILLED MY PARENTS. THEY WOULD HAVE KILLED ME TOO IF THEIR MAGE HADN'T RUN AWAY. I'LL NEVER SEE THEM AGAIN, NEVER FLY ALL BECAUSE OF HUMANS, AND THEY SHOULD DIE. ALL OF THEM. ONE TO TRUST, MY PARENTS TOLD ME THAT, AS THEY DIED SLOWLY” You manage to get out from under him and your need pulls the illusions from Trent and you vanish, at the same time three other Yous jumped out and formed a circle in front of the black dragon. The black dragon tore at them as more appeared and surrounded him “THERE WILL BE ONE TO TRUST THEY SAID, WHICHEVER ONE IT WAS THEY TRUSTED WAS PROBABLY THE ONE THAT KILLED THEM.” “Thanatos that is enough!” The matron bellowed as she entered the hall to see the confrontation. You notice for the first time that every other dragon in the room had surrounded you and Thanatos. The illusions fade and you become visible again. The matron crosses the hall “That crack damaged your wing not your head. Now leave. Remain in your cave until you are summoned.” Your not sure anybody else heard it but your sure Thanatos said under his breath, “You will love and you need the bond to temper you. I'll show them temper.” Before storming off to the caves. The matron looks at you. “There will be no brawling amongst the children, Again and you shall be sent off like Thanatos here.” Then she walks off. The other dragons are looking at you. Some come up and talk to you, you continue the conversation. By the time the hunters arrive with a ridiculous number of deer you are firm friends with one green dragon named Feran, two male reds called Thuras and Dacha and one female red called Riallin. When only a few deer were left, though how even this many young dragons got through that much meat eludes you, another child dragon entered the hall, practically bouncing up and down if not literally. He ran to his friends who happened to be Feran, Thuras, Dacha and Riallin as well as Theran, the dragon from earlier. You heard him tell them about the human he was guarding, probably Trent, and how he was making the room change with magic, definitely Trent. The rest of them were skeptical and agreed to follow him after he had eaten. Then he notices you, and says “Who's this? He new here.” Your introduced and introduced in turn, his name is Reodrad. You explain what you are, and how you got here, Reodrad nearly hit the roof when you said you had arrived with the human. After dinner you started to follow them but Theran said, “The matron said you don't leave here, I'm sorry.” They left and you went to the cave to rest, allowing invisibility to retake you so that you didn't run into Thanatos again. That was easy now, to shift in and out of that illusion. Something had been fixed in that fight with Thanatos. Resting you settle down and watch the show Trent is putting on through his own eyes.

14.content:
You quickly delve into your mind for that magical link you were so familiar with. Finding it, you ran into the entrance of the cave and screamed the only spell that could hold them at bay for a time. "TERRESTRIS MACERIA!" finally noticing your motives, the captain yells out for all to attack but it was to late, your spell took effect and the earth in front of the cave quickly rose toward the ceiling, temporarily sealing it shut. Grunting from the toll of this spell, It was the most powerful therefor the most draining, you start toward the interior of the cave. Hopefully the dragons wouldn’t char grill you straight away. Creeping forwards you try to not look scared, but also try to look respectful. You didn’t have to walk far before you encountered the first dragon.

From the roof it fell into sight, It's black hide shining in the darkness, wings raised into an aggressive stance, teeth bared and roaring at the top of its voice. Forget trying to stay brave, you had to force yourself not to turn tail and run for the hills. “P-please! I come in peace!” You stutter hoping it’ll hear you out.

'Then why, human, is there an army outside? You sink so low to attack a family that has done nothing to you?!'

Slightly startled at his speech inside your mind, you continue “No! I have sealed the entrance shut. I couldn’t let them just slaughter your family for the hell of it!” The dragon at this point seemed to lower its wings once hearing the reason the soldiers weren’t moving. It then lowered it’s head down so close to your face, its eye took your entire field of vision.

'If you are lying to me human, I will personally see to it that you and every human following you experiences unimaginable pain until you beg for death.' You nod, hands shaking slightly,

“I swear it to be true. I don’t agree with the war, so to help an innocent family would be an honor.” Hoping flattery would calm him, you take a step back and make an elegant bow which is usually reserved for a king.

The dragon stood up to full height, eying you carefully, it seemed to be deciding whether to trust you or not.

14.title: Earning Trust

141.content:
You sigh.

The words bring relief to your ears. You stop to listen and think. The Dragon had moved deeper inside for a moment, then emerged with his mate and settled around their nest.

The female looked straight into your eyes like a spear piercing your heart. "He is good." The family nodded.

"Trent." You state clearly. It seemed fitting to give them your name as they have obviously trusted you.
"This is our newborn. Once he hatches, you will care for him, feed him, and protect him. You must prove to me that you care. Take him to The flattest mountain. Don't eat anything you don't make for now you have been given the scale. You are now carrying a small part of dragon in your blood. A new task will wait for you on the flattest one mountain.

Questions begin to leap at you from all angles. This family isn't just letting me live... they are trusting me with their unborn son. What is going on? Why are they doing this?
141.title: "Very well." (Your Fully Trusted)

1411.content:
"Why does it matter? What will you do? Wh-" you start.
"SILENCE" the mother commanded.

You sit down quickly and listen as the dragon begins to explain how to care for the egg. Surprised at how simple it is, your mind begins to wonder. Though you kept note of some important facts to keep the hatchling well.

1. Be gentle when handling the egg.
2. Keep on your person at all times.
3. When moving carry firmly.
4. Keep warm at all times.
5. Once hatched feed him well.

"But still... Why are you doing this. Isn't this your son? Shouldn't you be the ones taking care of him? Why in the world are you letting me, who need I remind you was part of a group who was going to kill your family, raise him?"

"For one, you told us yourself that you were not harming my family," said the smaller female. "Am I to think that you lied to us?" Quickly shaking your head in the negative, she continued. "We do this because it is to be. Few of our kind know of the rider's ways and fewer still know of the bond they shared. We know this because the rider's are in our blood. Our son's blood. Your blood. The bond that a rider shares with their dragon is unlike any other. We only want the best for our son. Stealing this chance from him will be as if we killed him ourselves. Now you must hurry. These men were more than likely asked to report to a superior once the mission was completed and I doubt they will not investigate why they did not return. You must head West toward the Jupin wood. There you will find our homeland. Remove a scale from my hide and show it to the dragons there. You will be safe."

"But what about you? If they find you here-" The dragonness held up an opal claw to silence you once more.

"Do not worry. We will follow shortly. Do not think that just because you will be bonded with our son means that we will not continue to be his parents. We will continue watching the both of you for as long as we are able."

Satisfied, though still baffled by the events, you agreed and removed a scale and began to prepare to leave. After gathering provisions that the family gratefully provided, you head off into the mountains. You wonder where exactly to go. Jupin wood was quite the walk and, though you weren't sure, there should be a rather large river you would be required to cross. No matter though, you would get there. You began setting off holding the egg, which was quite large, very firmly.

14111.content:
You walk through the forested area with The scent of pine cones wafting in the dripping wet air. You have yet to enter the higher altitude of the mountains where you would assume the foliage would be much more scarce. It's so humid you almost want to dry yourself off as you carefully step through the lush green maze of undergrowth. The vines and moss cover any sign of grass.

The trees around you tower up so high it's dizzying to look at, though they do provide shade. You decide to make camp for the night. Looking around a bit in the brush and find a half eaten fish dead in the moss, there must be a lake nearby. You pass by a couple more fish until the trail leads to a magnificent lake with dazzling clear water. Having your dinner decided for the night, you begin gathering a few twigs and tinder nearby for a fire. After starting said fire, you use a glass jar you brought from the cave to boil some water and soak your tunic in. The jacket will keep you warm enough. After a moment you retrieve the cloth and delicately wrap it around the egg to warm it. You look around to check the perimeter, nerves high from being on the run. Sensing nothing, you gaze at your charge as you get ready for sleep. Content that it would be safe, you plant a small peck on it's opal shell and drift to sleep dreaming of the day it will hatch.
14111.title: First steps

141111.content:
You wake up in the morning and gather up the egg to prepare for the continuing journey. You tie together some of the vines to make a strap to hold the egg in, using moss to make a cushion, making sure nothing would happen to it. It is said that dragon eggs were unbreakable, but only fools tested that theory and you were no fool.

You then start along the first mountain in the chain, feeling quite optimistic about your journey. You know that by going into the mountains, you are much less likely to be detected by any patrols. You can feel the soft bump of the egg in the pouch against your hip and the thought of the tiny wonder inside crushed whatever small doubts that may have been lingering in your mind.

You continue your hike well into midday and your legs were starting to ache from their constant use. You decide to sit down and take a short break to rest your tired limbs and hopefully find a nearby source of water. Your leather cantine was down to half supply. Content with the quick rest, you got up ready to look for said water source when a muffled bang resounded throughout the area.
141111.title: Mountain Trek

choices: Continue on, trusting the dragons word
Run  back to attempt to warn them
1411111.content:
Mixed with fear and curiosity, you gingerly started toward the mysterious noise. Few footsteps in the soft moss underneath, you hear another immense clamor.

“What am I thinking?”, you say to yourself. “I am possibly the only human ever to bond and gain trust with the dragons. I could have just died in a cave painfully and they spared me, shouldn’t I at least deliver this precious cargo to the appointed place? Besides, I have no protection…except spells...”

You thought for a moment, decided that you had enough energy and stamina to withstand the draining consumption of magic, then started toward the towering tree.

Another gigantic din resonated through the misty forest air, this one slightly louder than the last. Something was about to happen, and something was about to happen quick. One hand firmly upon the soft, leather pouch containing the valuable scale, you started a brisk jog toward a nearby tree. The fragile leaves and sturdy branches seemed to provide a firm support for some sort of ascent. As you neared the trunk, a cry of many humans reached upon your ears, and another massive din, obviously louder than the one you heard before, echoed through the boughs and branches of the tree above you.

Still determined, you began the stealthy ascent. Having a sense that you might be watched, you made quick, silent movements, all the while being concealed by the shadows of leaves. Your view was constantly obstructed by the emerald foliage, but manage to find an opening few feet up.

With a muffled grunt, you heaved yourself up into the opening. Sunlight streamed past the emerald leaves, creating an ambient, jade glow. You looked to the direction of the noise to find a sight that left you very frightened.

A mass of men, all garbed in black armor from head to tow were marching in the opposite direction from you. Headed directly toward the dragon cave, 'Just like she said...' Each man was mounted on his own horse. This was no small militia group, this was an attack force.

You stay hidden, knowing what would happen if you were captured, but what of the dragons? Did they have enough time? Have they already left or are they still there? You felt a need to run back and warn them, but the consequences were pretty harsh if you were caught. What would you do?

142.content:
No where near good enough. You butchers! Your kind has been hunting us for ages. I need proof you are not bluffing just to lower my guard" The dragon stood up to full height.

"How must I show you I can be trusted?" you asked, starting to feel the fear swell in your body. The dragon stooped.

"Kill a soldier. Bring me back his head" the dragon replied. You could tell the tension was high, for the dragons breath has gone from a warm breeze to a hot vapor, making you sweat. A flair could be seen inside his nostrils.

Not wanting to upset the dragon, the only response that came to mind was, "How?"

Use your magic. I know you are capable, for I have seen you use it to shut the cavern entrance and I can see the aura of magic growing inside of you." The dragon paused, standing back up. "Follow any path and you will eventually come to a exit that has been sealed by rockfall or magic. A wizard, like you should be able to open it." The dragon said, so assured that you would not start an argument. Who in the right mind would argue with a dragon? But I did not want to have to kill an ally. Even though their intentions are wrong they were still humans. They may not have been the friendliest to you, but to kill your own kind just wasn't right. Doing this would throw their slight trust in you away for probably the same amount of trust in a dragon. Maybe I can trick the dragon but it seems he can sense magic.

Well, I have two options, I leave the cave and will eventually have to kill a comrade or trick the dragon into thinking I killed one. Or, I can stay here and try to convince the dragon that there is another option. However, I must do something fast, for the heat in the area is making me dizzy. So I've made up my mind, I have decided to...
142.title: Gaining trust

choices: How, exactly, would you use magic to trick them
Not good enough, I want a human head
1421.content:
"I will do as you ask but there is another way to detour the humans if you would give me the honor of offering it." you said, bowing your head, hoping the dragon would have the patience and tolerance to hear your advice.

"Go on" the dragon said. The temperature in the cave was cooling. Either the dragon was relaxing or the warm air has spread throughout the cave and mixed with any colder air.

"I can use my magic to make them believe I have killed you. They will believe me and leave from the entrance of the cave. No one gets killed that way." you said, knowing that there was a good chance you could not produce the outcome claimed. After all, you weren't an Illusion master.

You waited patiently, there was no word from the dragon. Apparently he was deep in thought. Was he beginning to trust you? After two minutes, the dragon finally replied
1421.title: A magical option

choices: Confess that you did not kill him purposely, but on accident.
Keep it to yourself. If he trusts you, why endanger that?
1422.content:
You decide that you really want the dragons to trust you, but at the same time, you really don't want to have to kill one of your own kind.

You head for an exit, and just as the dragon had said, it was sealed by a wall of piled rocks. Knowing that you only have about half of your magic left after your Terrestris Maceria spell, you decide to use the smallest amount possible. Focusing again on on the magic, you say the words of power. "IMPELLO TERRA!"

The spell activates, and you focus it into pushing out the boulders at the bottom of the pile. The rocks on the top roll out of the cave's mouth, and down a steep hill, opening a gap at the top easily wide enough for you to slip out of. Feeling very proud of yourself for only using a very low level spell to accomplish your goal, you climb over the remaining pile of stones.

As the dust clears and you are able to see again, you see something that makes you feel very sick indeed. One of the larger stones that had rolled down the hill had crashed into a man in full black armor. Even from this distance, you can see that he was crushed to death underneath the boulder as they had rolled together to the bottom.

You run over to check on him, knowing he is dead, but making sure anyway. You yank of the helmet to come face to face with an older man with dark brown hair and a bushy mustache. You shed a tear and give a small prayer over his body, using your hand to close his eyes.

In a sudden spontaneous decisions, you look for his sword. You find it a little ways back, and pick it up. You return to stand above the mans body, and raise the sword above your head. Closing your eyes to halt the advancing tears, you swing the sword down clumsily, and cut his head off.

"Gods, forgive me..." you say quietly, holding your breath, and you pick up the mans head after placing the sword in your belt.

You return up to the cave and enter through the gap you created. Wandering back to the main chamber is slow going, and it gives you time to think. You convince yourself that the man died by accident, whether you had anything to do with it or not. He was killed by a rock, and not you.

You also argue to yourself that having the dragons trust you will benefit both the races, and decide that borrowing that man's head was necessary.

Without even noticing it, you have returned into the dragon's chamber. "Very good human, you are diligent in your goal of gaining our trust. You now have it" the male dragon says.
1422.title: agree with the dragon and head for an exit.

choices: Suddenly feel very drained as the spell fails.
Suddenly hear the warcry of the soldiers.
144.content:
“Come with me human.” You nodded and fell behind it as it started walking back into the cave. You had to jog to keep up with it as he walked with large strides. Soon you came to an opening, just allowing the dragon to walk through it, but what came after it was awe inspiring. The huge cavern was lit by millions of little fires that were hung by crude torches.

But the next thing to attract your attention was a new dragon just as black as the male and curled around the black egg that you had seen only a few minutes before. 'Why did you bring him here!?' The obviously female dragon growled to the male, who replied with

'If he is to betray us, he will die, I sense he holds no malice towards us.'

She then got off the egg and trundled towards you, it was very unnerving, but you stood your ground. The female unlike the male, simply butted her head harshly into your chest nearly knocking you over. 'Human, swear an oath that you will not harm us, or any dragon unless in self defense now. Lest you wish to perish by our kind!' You agree to the oath quickly, knowing this would bind you for life. You cannot harm a dragon intentionally now. Not that you had this intention in the first place.

Suddenly, something happens, letting you know your spell has been breached, You…
144.title: Oath

choices: Your in a small room with deep impressions in the center
1441.content:
You suddenly have a wave of exhaustion wash over you making your head sag slightly, you know instantly why it’s happened, whenever a spell is used it causes fatigue, but holding a spell will drain you more when you release it, or it wears off like now.

You quickly gather your dregs of energy as even now you body was becoming more and more tired. You got to get out, they have broken through the seal and they’re coming! The soldiers are coming!' Both dragons looked at each other in surprise then back at the egg.

'We must get it out of the cave, but we can’t let these humans get our hoard.' Said the male dragon, the female quickly replied, 'You can’t fight them all on your own! We must get our child away from here…' she trailed off then looked at the male who then looked at you.

'You! You can get our egg to safety! Please, you swore to not harm a dragon, but can you help us? Take our egg out the small passage way behind that boulder until we come for you. Together we should be able to ‘take care’ of the men, but we’d be unable to protect our egg.' His look showed he was desperate as we could all hear the war cry and fast approaching chain mail boots of the soldiers.

Understanding the importance of this, you nod and without anymore coercing, you jump up and run towards the egg, grabbing it, then ran down the tiny passageway the male gestured to. As you run through the passage way, you feel the large round egg you clutch to your body tightly. You occasionally hear small chirps, and strange noises from it as well as a few slight movements.

Soon you hear several horrific sounds of battle behind you, mostly of men screaming, even if they were out to kill innocents you’d never wish pain on anyone. Too late now… suddenly you find light, finally getting out into the fresh air you look around and...
1441.title: Entrusted

choices: Climb back up to the top and keep climbing up to find a better way down.
14411.content:
Your on a sheer cliff. You stop suddenly and almost topple forward, but you manage to regain your balance. The sound of battle behind you has ceased, but you are still wary to go back in there. You look down over the edge and see tiny ledges on which to place a hand or a foot, but they are few and far between. The ledge you are on tapers off to either direction, and eventually drops down to the forested valley below. There is a river near the base of the cliff. It is deep and it meanders around rocky outcroppings. You think for a moment, but quickly realize that the choices are very limited.

If I go back, it may be a trap. I'm already tired as it is, and I don't want to risk the egg breaking. I've never tried a flying spell, it could be done, but it would be dangerous. It looks like there are places to climb down, but the ledges are small, and it's a LONG way down... What to do? What to do?!


You eventually decide to try and climb down. The rocks are dry, and easy to grip, but it is hard to hold onto the egg and climb at the same time. You look down after a few minutes, and see that it gets easier near the bottom. You get excited and move faster. Huge mistake. The ledge under your left foot crumbles and leaves you handing off the cliff by one hand. You...
14411.title: On a cliff

14412.content:
You realize that rather than being outside as you'd thought, you are inside a small room with no roof and deep gouges in the walls that remind you of much of scratch marks much like when a cat would scratch a log

As you look closer, you realize that that's exactly what they are, only much bigger and instead of wood of coarse, it is hard stone. As you're wondering what could've caused the scratch marks, You hear yells and screams.

All of a sudden, you feel an intense pain in your head as a dragon screams in pain. The sounds of the battle grow closer, and the egg is making a lot more noise. Realizing it must be close to hatching, you cradle it in your arms, wondering how you can help it. Then, you spot an opening in the wall...
14412.title: Your in a small room with deep impressions in t...

144122.content:
Deciding it is better to do as the dragons asked, you stay in the small opening hoping for the best. As the sounds of battle grow closer, the egg begins to shake even more violently. There are cracks begining to form on the egg. Unsure of what to do, you set it on the ground, 'I guess the best I could do is help it once it's out. I can't do much with the shell in the way.'

The sounds of battle begin fading, and with it comes an unwanted silence. Fearing for the worst, you forget about the egg and head for the entrance, when you hear a cry of pain. It was one of the dragons.

Suddenly There's a loud cracking from the egg, and then a piece falls off. You look into the gaping hole, and see nothing, just more blackness. Suddenly the blackness grows eyes and looks directly at you. Realizing what it is, you back away startled just in time for the shell to explode into tiny shards. What lay before you quite possibly could be the most beautiful creature you have ever seen. and it's attention was solely on you.

Cutting the moment short, however, A noise caught your attention. You turned toward the source and see that...
144122.title: stay in the room

1441222.content:
Well, he doesn't run in, he rather wobbles into the room.
He is covered with blood, and you hope it's not the dragons' one.
The soldier looks at you, then at the hatchling, and you can see, that he asks himself: Which one shall I kill first?
You do the first thing that comes to your mind to protect the both of you: You point at the soldier and scream: "ADICIO!"
A really forceful impact hits the soldier in his chest, and he flies back to where he came from.
But what now? You could seal this tunnel that leads to the room to protect yourself from more soldiers, but first of all, then couldn't the dragons enter, and second, what if the exhaustion caused by this spell drowns him until he's too weak to make his heart beat?
You have to make a decision here...
1441222.title: A soldier runs in

choices: Run and hide behind one of the five dragon eggs.
1442.content:
The roars of the attacking soldiers filled the air. You shuddered involuntarily at the sound, and wondered what had got them all riled up. You knew the answer, it was obvious, but you shied away from it. Your spell was failing. You began to feel sick. You had no clue what you could do to save these dragons.

The two grown dragons tensed, facing the entrance to their home. You sift through your brain, but can not think of anything. You can't remember anything you have learned. It is almost as if your brain has frozen. You start to panic. You know your spell won't last much longer.

Your vision is blurred; everything seems to be spinning. Then the floor seems to be getting closer. Your puzzled, for a moment, as to how the floor is rising, but *smack*! You realize you have fallen, face down, on the cave floor. You sit up shaking away the pain. "Human, you are bleeding from the nose." Says the big, male, dragon.

"Yeah I know. I think I broke it." I mumbled, blood rushing to my cheeks

"Clumsy beast." The female said

You begin to sense she doesn't like you much. You feel aggravated, without you, they would all be dead. You push those thoughts out of your head. Then you panic. You feel your spell fading. What are you going to do!?!?
1442.title: Suddenly hear the warcry of the soldiers.

145.content:
The dragon stayed silent for a while, eying you suspiciously causing you to shiver. Now it was impossible to hide your fear at all. You were sure the huge beast was about to burn you into ashes, and almost regretted to have tried and help the dragons.

You lowered your head, fighting to keep enough dignity to not beg for mercy. You didn't like the idea of perishing as a coward.

You were surprised when the dragon slowly and quietly spoke in your mind, 'We'll see, human... You seem sincere, but I need time to trust you.'

You lifted your gaze, quite relieved since the dragon apparently wasn't going to kill you immediately, yet still nervous since the giant clearly wasn't fully trusting you.

"Time?" you said in a trembling voice. "Do you mean I may stay here for a while?"

"No" he answered in a cold voice. "You MUST stay here!"

You froze in fear, realizing what the colossal being was meaning.

The dragon confirmed your fears, 'Nobody, dragon or not, is allowed to come here and survive unless they are a friend. I won't kill you now because I don't know if you're an enemy, but I can't let you go because I don't know if you're a friend so, you're going to be my captive, until I make my decision about it. I'll examine you and interrogate you... if you behave, no harm will come to you during your captivity, and if i eventually find out you're trustworthy, you'll be set free and will be considered a friend of my family. But if you give me the slightest motive of suspicion...' the dragon bared his teeth and ground his talons in the rocky floor, 'I'll give you a slow and painful death, even worse than the death your companions are going to get from us. Got it?'

Now scared to death, you nodded: obeying was the only way of surviving! The dragon grunted and lowered a massive paw toward you.

Scared, you crouched and covered yourself with your arms, fearing of being slashed or crushed; instead, you were just grabbed by the collar of your jacket and lifted into the air like a small kitten, while your captor walked, carrying you deeper and deeper into the cavern.

Dangling helplessly from the dragon's paw, you still felt terrified, unsure of what was going to happen to you, yet you couldn't avoid to notice how beautiful that place looked, the stone walls being nicely carved and light was given by crude torches.
The dragons were quite civilized, you thought, also noticing that several carvings showen dragons and humans being friendly together. That comforted you a bit. The dragons clearly could accept humans as friends. At least these could. His statement of no one is welcome here, dragon or not, rung in your head.

Finally the dragon came to an opening and carried you into a huge room, where you saw...
145.title: Captive

choices: The new dragon begins to question you.
The new dragon first tends to the egg
1451.content:
The room you entered was poorly lit so you could only see a few feet ahead of yourself in any direction. The walls were all artistically carved from what you could make out.The many drawings around it to small to be done by a dragon's claws. Proof to your thoughts that humans and dragons could and have coexisted before.

But what your eyes were drawn to the most was an egg. But not just any egg. This was far bigger than anything a farm animal could lay. This was most definitely a dragons offspring. And as if the size was not proof enough, the shell matched your captors scales almost perfectly. Almost outshining them even with their ominous black glow.

Your captor halted in front of the egg and set you down rather roughly only to let loose a mighty roar that prevented you from moving, as you were busy covering your ears from the noise it created. No sooner had he done this, another dragon with feather-like wings came out the opening from behind the opal egg. It's scales a much darker black and it's even blacker eyes staring directly at you.
1451.title: Dragon and egg

14512.content:
Its gaze lingers on you for only a brief moment then sweetly it looks at the shimmering egg. Lifting its large slender tail the dragon began to rub the egg. The gentle movements creating swirling black currents to flow over the surface and the way in which the dragon was stroking the egg made it appear to be polishing the gleaming shell. Then with graceful movements it adjusts the egg to a new resting position and curls its self about it. With a deep sigh and a flip of its graceful wings the egg was gone, wrapped in its parents embrace and blending with the scales that were mirrored so flawlessly by the offspring.
Once in a comfortable position the dragon again looks toward you its eyes glimmering in the dark had an amused look in them and you hear a soft melodious voice cooing in your mind and almost, your heart.
“A human. This is a very unexpected surprise my dear. Is he to be our dinner, or were you simply supplying entertainment for the egg?” The female dragon seemed to smile her toothy grin both beautiful and fearsome.
Her mate simply growled in reply and stood over you with a mighty strength. The two dragons were so different in personality yet they had a love for each other that filled the chamber. It reminds you of a newlywed couple in the human world. It is baffling that dragons and humans have so much in common, yet they both fear and hate the other.
“Watch him. I don’t know if we can trust him. I must deal with a little… pest problem outside.” The male dragon’s voice startled you from your thoughts as he turns to walk out of the chamber, his massive tail nearly flooring you.
“Oh do be careful dear. Even the smallest of pests may have a sting.” Her chuckle was both deep and beastly as well as musical and soothing. She was a very bewildering creature.
Again he growled and with no more reply he was gone.
You are left in the care of the female dragon with her egg. What do you do?
14512.title: The new dragon first tends to the egg

choices: Before Trent could decide, something happened....
1452.content:
No matter how much you tried to make out your surroundings, the darkness in that room prevented you from finding out which kind of place you were now.... that worsened your fear: despite the dragon's half-promise about sparing your life, at least for now, you were afraid that he could have changed his mind and carried you into a torture chamber... or perhaps, many other dragons were hidden in the deep blackness, ready to jump on you and use you as a snack...

"Ouch!" Your terrified thoughts were abruptly interrupted when the scaly giant dropped you onto the hard stone ground. Moaning, you sat up, massaging your aching backside, and looking up you could feel, rather than see, the dragon's huge form looming above you.

*Stay here until I came to retrieve you.* the sharp command echoed in your mind in a deceivingly calm and cold tone.

"How long am I going to stay here?" you asked, and then screamed while an excruciating pain exploded from your left shoulder. Crouching on the ground, clutching the aching spot, after a couple seconds you realized what had striken you: the dragon's tail, used like a whip!

*You aren't in the position of asking questions.* Now the giant's tone was evidently angry. *You'd better realize that.* With that, a whooshing sound and a cold rush of air barely above your head signaled to you that the deadly tail was being threateningly swung, and you whimpered in terror.

Expecting a new swinging, you felt relieved, hearing thunderous footsteps walking away from you, and then you spotted the massive shilouette against the only source of light, the room entrance; after one moment, the dragon disappeared from your sight and the footsteps faded, leaving you in a miserable state of fear and humiliation.

So scared you were, that a couple minutes passed, before you realized that the door entrance had not been blocked... that brought a dilemma into your mind...

"Should I try an escape, or rather wait here quietly as the dragon ordered?"
1452.title: Darkness

14522.content:
"That dragons doesn't seem to be a monster." you mused. "He has spared me, when a human would've probably slaughtered me without even allowing me to speak... I want to try and become their friend."

That decision taken, you waited, sitting quietly in the darkness, your hopes fighting against your worries about the dragons not trusting you.
But what other choice you had? Even if you tried an escape, how could you find a way out of that labirinth of corridors, before being caught? It was better to stay and hope for the better.

After an eternity (or perhaps just a couple hours) you gasped, hearing approaching footsteps, and then a huge shadow appeared on the entrance of the room, and you heard a thundering voice talking to you....
14522.title: Waiting and Hoping

choices: The dragon doesn't like your tale.
145221.content:
*Come, human. We have a lot to talk about.*

The voice speaking in your mind was without doubt your captor's, and the dragon didn't seem friendlier than earlier. Afraid of getting him even angrier and more suspicious than he already was, you ran toward the huge beast, who grabbed you roughly by your scuff once more, and started to carry you along the ubelievably big caves, swinging you back and forth in the process, until he stopped inside what looked a chamber, with torches on the stone walls and a pile of straw as a bed.

You were dropped onto the floor, and crouched there, looking up to the dragon's powerful presence looming above you and to his stern face... feeling like a bug that's about to be squashed.

*Time to know each other better* the dragon said with a hint of sarcasm in his tone. *First, you now will tell me, and I said EVERYTHING* his tone grew extremely threatening *about yourself, your motives for joining our attackers and what you know about them. And I hope, for your sake, that I'm going to like your tale.* He punctuated his last sentence by lifting his tail above you and keeping it in that position, and you froze in fear, realizing what was in store for you if your captor did NOT like your tale!

You started to talk....
145221.title: Interrogation

145222.content:
“I am glad to see you headed our words human. I would have hated to kill one so young.”
Her voice seemed almost jovial for the circumstances. However, you feel a peace settle on your mind and realize she has not come to harm you.
“I was sent here to guard you little one. To keep you safe.”
“Keep me safe?” you ask. The previous dragon did not appear to be concerned for your wellbeing at all. “Does that mean you trust me?”
“We are still determining if you are friend or foe. Though following orders has helped you in my eyes” with that she gave a deep grumble in her chest. A sound of satisfaction and contentment.
You can't believe what is happening. One moment you are fearing for your life. The next you almost feel at home. It has been a long time since you felt so calm. Yet you can't help but wonder about the rest of your party. Did they get into the cave? Has a battle begun? You begin to feel anxious and you start to fidget. The uncertainty becomes deeper and deeper until you can not control it any longer.
“What is happening out there!?” you shout, forgetting that you are in the presence of a great dragon. “How are you so calm? What if they need your help? We can't just sit here. We have to do something!”
You leap to your feet. Deciding that something must be done!

The speed of growth then slows to about a foot a year then around the age of ten slows again to a foot every five years. Though the process continually slows with age, dragons continue to grow until the day they die. Judging Fenrir's hight at about 42 feet, according to him he would be about 100 years old, but probably even older since he said the process continues to slow."

I encourage everyone to review and add to this story so that it may become what i know it can be.

Description:
Be prepared to begin a journey never like none other. You are about to be thrown into the life of Trent Godfrey, A young wizard in training on a journey unbeknown to him to become a Dragon Rider. Every choice you make will effect the outcome of the story, be it good or bad. One man may be a friend with one choice and an enemy with the other. Good, Evil, none of this matters when the choice is before you. No choice is right or wrong. Only the outcome matters and the only way to find out is to plunge inside and take the risk. Only one moment will remain the same, the beginning. And the rest is all up to a fate you yourself will create.

You are a young wizard named Trent Godfrey, a 16 year old boy with short brown curly hair and a very calming demeanor. Stripped from your hometown Parcel to be newly enlisted in the human militia which is at war with dragon kind, because of your abilities with the fabled "Defensive" magic, you were suddenly sent on an assassination mission with a small band of men. A war has been going on for nearly 20 years in the land of Shoven between the humans and dragons. Though you have no ill will toward these creatures, they do not hold you in the same regard nor do your fellow soldiers give mercy to the enemy. With the war giving way to neither side, it seems it will drag on for eternity. Wearing the standard black hooded vest and pants with light leather guards on your arms and shins, black as well, The story begins as you approach your intended target.

For a more in depth description of Trent and how the story truly begins, check out "A Wizard and his Dragon: The Novel"
